Job Description:
Varis stands as a pioneering force in the realm of digital procurement and commerce, serving as the nexus where buying organizations and suppliers seamlessly unite, forge contracts, transact, and prosper together. As a rapidly ascending technology startup, our core focus lies in digital commerce software-as-a-service and procurement, specifically within the dynamic landscape of B2B e-commerce.At the heart of Varis beats an unwavering commitment to innovation and a customer-centric ethos that is poised to revolutionize business-to-business marketplaces. Joining our team at this juncture is akin to stepping onto the ground floor of an extraordinary opportunity to co-shape our destiny. Here, you'll not only witness but actively participate in the direct impact of your work, surrounded by a cadre of passionate individuals. You'll find yourself at the epicenter of a profoundly dynamic business model teeming with untapped individual and collective potential.Your passion, innovation, and creativity are the very catalysts that will propel us to unprecedented heights. Join us today and be instrumental in propelling Varis into a future brimming with promise and possibility.As a Sr. Lead Product Manager, your role will encompass the complete software product lifecycle for your designated product areas. This includes inception, launch, fostering adoption, and continuous improvement. Your primary responsibility will be to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, such as engineering, design, marketing, customer success, sales, and more, to articulate and execute the product vision geared towards ensuring customer success. Furthermore, you will establish strong ties with customers and internal stakeholders to gain insights into customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscapes, all of which will drive informed decisions regarding the product roadmap.The ideal candidate will bring a proven track record in shaping a product roadmap and successfully executing it. This entails everything from leading customer and prospective customer discovery efforts, to partnering with the marketing team for a successful product release, and ongoing monitoring of usage.What You'll Do:Drive the complete product lifecycle, encompassing the identification and definition of product requirements, as well as the supervision of development, testing, and release phases.Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and sales, to ensure the timely and budget-conscious delivery of high-quality products.Conduct comprehensive market research and competitor analysis to identify market trends, discern customer needs, and uncover opportunities for product enhancements.When necessary, establish and maintain relationships with vendors and partners for seamless integration of their products into our solution offerings.Foster close relationships with stakeholders such as customers, sales teams, and customer success to solicit feedback and guarantee customer satisfaction.Define and prioritize product features and enhancements by considering business and customer needs, market analysis, and technical feasibility.Develop and communicate a well-defined product roadmap and vision to internal teams and stakeholders, aligning everyone toward a common goal. Emphasize the business rationale and the "why" behind requirements for our engineering teams.Rapidly acquire and act as a subject matter expert in your product areas through research, customer engagement, and collaboration with internal and external experts. Provide guidance and support to the team, particularly in the realm of e-procurement.Author and present clear requirements, including associated user stories, to your partners in engineering and design.Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies related to e-procurement and your specific product area. Incorporate innovative solutions into the product strategy as appropriate.Monitor and analyze product performance and gather user feedback to iterate and improve product offerings.Ensure effective communication and collaboration within the team and across different departments to achieve product success.What You'll Need (Required):Work Experience: Possess 5-7 years of demonstrated experience as a product manager in e-procurement, B2B eCommerce, payments technology, or a related software company, with a track record of successfully launching these products to market.Domain Experience: Exhibit expertise in both building a product from the ground up and maturing existing products.Analytical Skills: Showcase exceptional analytical prowess, capable of refining strategic and technical roadmaps and synthesizing insights to drive improvements and recommendations.Communication Skills: Display excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a regular requirement to deliver presentations to stakeholders. Articulate research findings, design decisions, and formulate strategies in a clear and compelling manner that resonates with and is easily understood by stakeholders.Interpersonal/People Skills: Demonstrate the ability to facilitate seamless collaboration and foster relationships essential for success in this role. Build trust among team members and effectively influence others. Possesses strong presentation skills when interacting with leadership, customers, and engineering teams, along with exceptional relationship-building capabilities.What you'll need (Nice to Have!):Education: A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Software Development, Business, or equivalent work experience.Domain Experience: Experience in leading the delivery of catalog ingestion products for e-procurement or e-commerce. Previous experience as a platform Product Manager is a plus.Technology: Familiarity with cloud architecture and design, with a preference for expertise in Azure.Leadership Qualities: A proven track record of effectively mentoring and coaching developing product managers. The ability to consistently drive results, exhibit confidence not only in oneself but also in others, and inspire and motivate team performance. Demonstrated capability to navigate complex situations and tasks with composure, setting a positive example for others.Experience: Experience in a fast-growing startup or early-stage company is desired, with a preference for candidates who have joined at a similar company size to our current stage.At Varis, pay scales are determined by role, level, location, and alignment with market data. Individual pay is determined through interviews and an assessment of several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to, job-related skills, relevant education and experience, certifications, abilities of the candidate, and pay relative to other team members.The figures in this range reflect the average annual base salary for the given role, while additional variable incentives based on performance may also be available. Recruiters can share more information about our bonus program, benefits, and equity during the hiring process.Pay Range$135,000‚Äî$140,000 USDThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification and are not intended to be a complete list of all required responsibilities and skills. Other duties and special projects may be assigned per business needs. Job descriptions are subject to change at any time with or without notice.Benefits and PerksMedical / dental / vision, AD&D, and Life InsurancePaid Time Offer (PTO) and company paid holidaysHealth Saving Account (HSA)Long Term Disability and Short-Term Disability401(k) matching programDiscounted auto, home, and pet insuranceRetirement savings plan rolloversBanking servicesMilitary leaveEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Regular pay for funeral/memorial service observanceDiscounts on Office Depot/Microsoft/Apple products and servicesOpportunity for professional growth and career advancementVaris, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all employment practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, age, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in alignment with the City & County of San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.CCPA disclosure notice here.

Who We Are:We are a tech-enabled growth firm‚Äìat the intersection of marketing, consulting & data intelligence‚Äìigniting revenue and brand recognition for leading and emerging companies around the world. As a people-first firm, we value diversity in backgrounds and experiences. We strongly believe our people and culture are key to our success. Our vision is to be recognized as the most valued and respected private growth marketing firm in the world‚Äìwith a scalable brand, culture and services.As a full-service growth marketing firm, we offer best-in-class services including: SEO, Content Marketing, Paid Media, Social Media Marketing, Programmatic + CTV, Public Relations, Influencer Marketing, Email + SMS, Conversion Rate Optimization, Retail Marketing, Creative, and Web Development. Here at Power Digital, we are hyper-focused on helping brands drive revenue growth and brand recognition, ultimately driving irrefutable value for our clients.At the heart of Power Digital is our proprietary technology, nova, which analyzes businesses through first-party data, simplifying investment planning for marketing and diligence in M&A‚Äì‚Äìputting marketers in a strategic seat at the table‚Äì‚Äìand providing value in unparalleled ways.Managing billions in media, our dynamic team‚Äì‚Äìof consultative marketers, creatives, analysts and technologists‚Äì‚Äìchallenge traditional ways of planning and measurement through meticulous testing and data science across each milestone of the customer journey.**We support 100% remote, in-office, or hybrid work styles for anyone legally eligible to work in the U.S.We are looking for an experienced product manager who is an expert in managing product roadmaps, developing feature requirements, and delivering high quality software.In 2020 Power Digital launched nova, our proprietary platform for digital marketing auditing, forecasting, planning, and reporting. The nova platform integrates data from hundreds of clients and dozens of data sources. Using this data, it can analyze and make predictions for over 50 marketing strategies in 13 marketing channels to provide insights and tools for our customers.A key responsibility for this Product Manager will be to develop and maintain a product roadmap and individual feature requirement documents for the nova software. This role will work with leadership, business stakeholders, engineering, and design to scope and prioritize new features and changes to existing product functionality. You will manage a backlog of user stories and acceptance criteria and work closely with engineering to manage sprint and software release cycles. You will be responsible for QA and User Acceptance Testing to ensure that the delivered software meets requirements.A day in the life:A day in the life of a nova Product Manager is a dynamic blend of strategic thinking, tactical execution, and cross-functional collaboration. The day often starts with a review of key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the health and impact of the product suite, followed by a stand-up meeting with the engineering team to prioritize development tasks. With an unwavering focus on user experience, the Product Manager liaises with the UX design team to ensure that the product not only meets but exceeds user expectations. Throughout the day, they engage in stakeholder meetings, aligning product development with overarching business goals and customer needs. They also make data-driven decisions by constantly analyzing user feedback and market trends. The Product Manager often closes the day by updating the product roadmap, ensuring it reflects both short-term deliverables and long-term strategic objectives. This holistic approach enables them to effectively guide the product through various stages of its lifecycle, continually driving towards excellence in innovation, functionality, and user engagement.ResponsibilitiesDefine a prioritized a software roadmap that maps to core product goals, timelines, and our overall strategic vision for the nova platformMeet with leaders, engineers, and Company OverviewHarbor Compliance is a fast-growing technology company reinventing how nonprofits and businesses manage critical areas of compliance. An Inc. 5000 and Deloitte Technology Fast 500 honoree, Harbor Compliance is using technology to simplify the complexities of business licensing and legal entity management.In 2021, we merged with Labyrinth, Inc. We have scaled to 35,000+ clients and, even after 10 years, are still just getting started.Position OverviewHarbor Compliance is looking for a skilled Product Manager to join our expanding Product organization. In this role, you will partner with internal stakeholders and external end-users to collect, document, validate, and quantify ideas for improving our product offerings and solutions to our clients' compliance needs. You will work with multiple software development teams and products, launch new products, and track market acceptance. If you‚Äôre interested in venturing outside the norm and are ready to join a company with a proven business model, we‚Äôd love to learn more about you.Required QualificationsDevelops new software product concepts, designs, and/or enhancements to existing product design that reflect market and user requirementsConducts research and develops a good understanding of the customer's needs, new technologies, trends in the market, and competitorsDevelops requirements documents, functional specifications, and mock-ups to clearly illustrate product ideas and conceptsMember of a cross-functional team that translates customer needs and technology directions into product definitionsExperience documenting user journeys and data flows to understand the bigger picture when creating individual requirementsProven track record of success analyzing, documenting, and refining business processes and needsAbility to understand stakeholder feedback and turn that into specific action-oriented solutions to drive client and business successExperience conceptualizing and explaining user experiencesAbility to work with technical users and software engineersProven ability to work across multiple departments to drive consensus solutionsExperience with Jira or a related requirements-management solutionStrong understanding of SaaS platformsPrevious experience working within an Agile Scrum environmentAbility to organize and plan meetings that are efficient and deliver meaningful progressPreferred QualificationsExperience creating basic UX concepts for the purpose of describing how a function should perform and how a user should interact with the system3+ years of experience as a Product Manager or Business Analyst working with Saas solutionsLocation and HoursThis is a full-time position. You are welcome to work remotely or from our Rockville, MD, or Lancaster, PA, offices.CompensationCompetitive salary and generous benefits including paid time off; seven paid holidays; health plan including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; and a 401(k) retirement plan with a company match program.Harbor Compliance is an equal-opportunity employer.

Product ManagerRemote | Product | Full-TimeWHO WE ARENcontracts provides comprehensive vendor, compliance, risk management, and lending compliance solutions to a rapidly expanding customer base of over 4,000 financial institutions in the United States. We help financial institutions achieve their compliance and risk management goals with a powerful combination of user-friendly, cloud-based software and expert services. Our solution suite encompasses the complete lifecycle of risk, including vendor management, enterprise risk management, business continuity, compliance, audit and findings management, and cybersecurity. The company was named to the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing private companies in America for the fourth consecutive year. For more information visitwww.ncontracts.comor follow the company onLinkedInandTwitter.THE ROLEAs a Product Manager at Ncontracts, you will contribute to the product line strategy for the products you own and ensure our customers are delighted by the products you put in front of them through flawless execution. You will play a vital role in leading your squad on their journey to building these products and we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business and your career.In this role, you will be responsible for:Relentlessly Prioritizing product capabilities based on market trends and customer needs to meet the requirements of more than 4,000 customers. With a business growing as fast as we are, there is no lack of opportunities to pursue every day. What you decide to put in front of the teams to deliver is vitally important to our success.Collaborating with customers, potential customers, and internal stakeholders to identify and recommend the right solution at the right time considering our strategic direction, your research, and knowledge of our capabilities.Assist in GTM Activities so that our customers who rely on Ncontracts as a key part of their business process understand the value of our products and services. Communicating new features and product improvements, both internally and externally, will improve adoption and overall customer delight.Learning from your fellow product team members and mentors within the organization with a thirst for knowledge to grow your career as a product manager. We strive to be a world-class product organization that builds elegant, market-driven products for our customers and potential customers across various industries.Educating others about your product line, both internal teams and customers, to contribute to the overall success of the portfolio.YOU WILLThe ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working with development teams, internal stakeholders, and customers to prioritize, document, and direct the delivery of new features and enhancements to existing software products.Results Driven: We are looking for a hungry, driven Product Manager that can deliver results, not just outcomes, across the teams you serve.Customer-Centric: In addition to optimizing the delivery of our products, the product team must remain customer-centric and always put the customer first while testing, deploying, and executing hypotheses.A Communicator: The ability to clearly articulate complex problems and solutions to audiences with varying degrees of technical acumen is vital to growing a successful product.Analytical: Possess strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy and enjoy leveraging data to make decisions.A Negotiator: Able to build strong relationships and achieve compromise with cross-functional teams to move towards a clear objective and outcome.THE ESSENTIALSA bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or related discipline; MBA preferred3+ years of relevant work experience, ideally in a B2B SaaS company, is requiredExperience working in an agile software development environment is strongly preferredExperience in the financial services technology ("FinTech") or Regulatory (RegTech) industry is preferredWorking knowledge of common statistical and analytical techniques as part of commercially available data analysis solutions is highly desirableExperience with one or more product analytics tools such as Pendo, Amplitude or Adobe Analytics is preferredWE OFFERA fun, fast-paced work environmentResponsible PTO Plan that meets or exceeds state and local medical and family leave laws11 paid holidaysCommunity and social events to keep you connected and engagedMental Health BenefitsMedical, Dental and Vision insuranceCompany-paid Group Life Insurance, Short- and Long-Term DisabilityFlexible Spending Account & Health Savings AccountAflac Benefits ‚Äì Critical Illness, Cancer Protection, & Hospital ChoicePet Insurance401 (k) with company match with eligibility on Day 1 of employment2 Paid Volunteer Time Off DaysAnd much more!Compensation InformationPursuant to state and local law disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience and location is $105,000 to $115,000 per year. This position may be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. The incentive award amount is dependent upon company performance and your personal performance and is not guaranteed.AAP/EEO StatementNcontracts provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.Other DutiesPlease note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Uncapped commissions which makes your total comp the investment you put in the position.Leading medical/surgical products distributor is seeking a full-time field sales representative for the Washington (Seattle), Oregon and Alaska territory. This position requires an experienced sales person who can not only sell products but also recognize new opportunities with both new and existing customers. Preferred candidate would have a documented success history selling in the following areas: Operating room, inpatient pharmacy and/or compounding pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, and/or IV Therapy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a strong proven sales record with solid relationship skills.The Company offers a Base salary, an uncapped commission program, defined and protected territories, approved expenses, mileage reimbursement, insurance benefits package and 401(k) matching. About SiloHelp us rebuild the oldest system in the world - the agricultural supply chainSilo builds technologies which bring efficiency and transparency to the agricultural supply chain. Our modern ERP dramatically increases profits, improves product freshness, and reduces food waste for farmers, wholesalers, distributors, and buyers.We are a highly motivated team of engineers, designers, business and agricultural specialists taking on the challenge of transforming a centuries old industry. We are looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energized to work cross functionally to realize Silo‚Äôs enormous potential.Silo has funding from preeminent investors like Andreessen Horowitz, Initialized Capital, Haystack, and Garry Tan. Silo is headquartered in San Francisco with distributed teams located across the United States and internationally.Why Silo?We will work hard to make sure your decision to join us is worthwhile and rewarding. You‚Äôll learn how a start-up operates and learn skills that will help you at any point in your career. You will be empowered to take initiative and get support to execute an idea from beginning to the end.The Role:As a Sales Development Representative, you will expand Silo‚Äôs business by discovering qualified prospects, understanding where their business can be improved, and communicating the value of Silo‚Äôs products in helping achieve those improvements. You will work directly with our Account Executives to become the Quarterbacks of your assigned territory, generating pipeline via whatever strategy you deem most effective. You must effectively communicate the value and functionality of Silo, follow the Silo playbook, and maintain detailed records of interactions and leads in our Salesforce CRM. Additionally, you‚Äôll take a data backed approach to prospecting, outreach and pipeline generation. You will need to be comfortable with change that comes at a fast start up and the ability to sell a product that is new to the market.Responsibilities:Achieve monthly quotas of leads sourced, meetings scheduled, and qualified opportunities generatedResearch and prioritize strategic target account lists within a defined territoryMaintain accurate account & activity information in Salesforce (i.e. adding contacts, sending emails, strategic calling)Conduct high-level conversations with senior executives in prospect accounts by phone and emailCollaborate with other departments to identify product improvements, modifications or changes that could enhance its overall performance and attractiveness of our platformWhat Makes A Great Candidate:Bilingual (Spanish/English) is a plusSuperior verbal and written communication skillsCommitment to pursuing a career in salesConsistent track record of overachievementCompetitive, resilient, and highly motivatedA great attitude and love for teamworkBA/BS Degree or equivalent work experienceAble to be in office (NYC) several times a week and operate in a hybrid environment Benefits & PerksIn addition to a competitive salary, commissions and equity, Silo offers comprehensive company sponsored health insurance, wellness and meal stipends, unlimited PTO, 401(k), and a substantial paid parental leave policy. We have a work hard, play hard culture.How to ApplyWe are committed to building a diverse team of people from a wide variety of backgrounds, and encourage anyone to apply.Apply with your resume and we‚Äôll be in touch.Silo is committed to offering competitive, fair, and commensurate compensation. Actual compensation will be based on multiple factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to a candidate‚Äôs job-related skills, experience, education or training, and location. Job Title: Business to Business Sales Representative - Remote Option
Job Description:
MISSIONMissions are accomplished with people, driving towards a greater purpose. Foley has been a trusted partner to motor carriers of all sizes. Our technologically advanced approach to DOT compliance automates many of the background screening and compliance requirements motor carriers must comply with- making it easier for them to onboard and retain the right driver for their business. At Foley we just don‚Äôt help our customers stay compliant ‚Äì we help them thrive.A positive attitude is everything. At Foley, we‚Äôve created a culture that rewards kindness, enthusiasm, and a can-do attitude. Whether we‚Äôre working together internally or helping a customer solve a problem, we approach every challenge with a sense of humor, optimism, and the determination to succeed.BUSINESS TO BUSINESS SALES REPRESENTATIVE Are you ready to take the training, leads, and marketing support we provide and turn them into a thriving sales career?Join our dynamic team as we seek driven and enthusiastic sales professionals for our growing B2B Sales division. In this role, you'll seize the opportunity to connect with potential customers through outbound business-to-business calls. Your mission: determine their regulatory needs, introduce them to our diverse range of SAAS products and services, and propose tailored solutions that cater to their business requirements.This is a remote option- those residing in CT, MA, GA, FL, TX are welcome to apply! Who You Will Work WithAs a sales representative at Foley, you'll learn from the best. Your supervisor will play a pivotal role as your coach, supporting your growth, refining sales techniques, and ensuring you excel in meeting your assigned quotas.All our supervisors have climbed the ranks from sales roles, so you can trust that they understand and have mastered what they're guiding you to achieve.At Foley, we value continuous improvement and invite your input to foster collaboration across roles and departments. Your fresh insights could be the key to our collective success!What You Will DoIn your first 90 days, you‚Äôll Acquire an in-depth understanding of Foley's products, services, and their potential positive impact on customers' businesses.Familiarize yourself with the various functions and teams within Foley and how they contribute to customer interactions.Develop your technical toolkit to stay on task and provide effective support.Engage with SAAS leads understanding their unique needs and pain points specific to SAAS Solutions. Safeguard both Foley's and our customers' information, adhering to established company policies and procedures.What We‚Äôd Like You To Have1-2 years of SAAS solution sales experience, demonstrating a track record of success, preferably in a BDR/SDR role.Experience maintaining accurate and up-to-date records of lead interactions and activities in SFDC (Salesforce Dot Com), preferred. Proven ability to consistently surpass quotas.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Strong work ethic and the ability to maintain self-discipline.This position features a base plus commission compensation plan, offering uncapped earnings and immediate commission eligibility. We're excited to have you on board and can't wait to witness your contribution to our sales success story.At Foley, we provide the tools, mentorship, and collaborative environment for your sales career to flourish. Your efforts will directly impact the growth of our customer base and the success of our organization. Join us today and be part of our dynamic journey!First Year Potential Earnings: $60,000-$70,000 (Base $17.00/hr.)What You‚Äôll Love About FoleyThe people! Our employees and customers consistently express the best thing about Foley is our close-knit, exceptionally talented teams. Check out our customers feedback ‚Äì on TrustpilotOutstanding benefits. 3 medical plans to choose from, 2 level dental, and 2 level vision plans. Job DescriptionJob DescriptionIronwood Connections is a national distributor of high quality wrought iron stair parts and wooden stair components. Whether your customer is a homeowner, retailer or a home builder, the timeless design and quality craftsmanship of House of Forgings‚Äô stair and railing products will attract the attention of the most discerning eye.We manufacture over 2,000 active SKUs in over 200,000 sq. ft. of warehouse space. Our impeccably crafted styles are originally designed in partnership with our Italian studio and created with the sense of pride in workmanship that can only be found in an employee owned company.Our building is new, dynamic, has a great team and we are growing. Come be a part of our team!Job Brief: Much of time spent outside location doing in home sales consultations for remodels. Outside Sales Representative ensures efficient and effective sales operations and relations with homeowners and remodel contractors. Sells products and services in home or our showroom by performing the following duties.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following including: Compiles lists of prospective customers for use as sales leads, based call in and leads generated by our website.  Travels throughout assigned territory to call on regular and prospective customers to solicit orders, or talks with customers on sales floor or by phone.  Displays or demonstrates product, using samples or catalog, and emphasizes salable features. Prepare, coordinate and communicate price quotations, terms of sales, delivery dates and service obligations to customers/contractors. Prepares reports of business transactions and keeps expense accountsTracks stock levels. Resolve customer complaints and problems. Enters new customer data and other sales data for current customers into computer database. Develops and maintains relationships with purchasing contacts. Assist in the collection of accounts receivable. Attend custom builder meetings as necessary. Other duties as assigned by location management. Required SkillsSpecial skills required: Working knowledge of building materials industry and products, ability to negotiate prices and contractual agreements. Special knowledge required: Working knowledge of accounting principles and local building codes and compliance requirements. Other: Computer literateCompetency: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.  Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.  Business Acumen - Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with strategic goals.  Strategic Thinking - Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals; Understands organization's strengths & weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition; Identifies external threats and opportunities; Adapts strategy to changing conditions. As a member of our team you will enjoy:Base salary plus commissionBenefits packageMonthly allowance for car, fuel, and cell phoneCompany provided laptopCompany DescriptionHouse of Forgings is an established leader in the sales and distribution of luxe stair and railing products for residential and light commercial building segments. House of Forgings has aggressive plans for growth with multiple sales channels and growing distribution network. We have logistics points in Houston, Austin, and Dallas Texas, as well as operations in Conover, North Carolina and Denver, Colorado.www.houseofforgings.netHouse of Forgings is an established leader in the sales and distribution of luxe stair and railing products for residential and light commercial building segments. We value family, heritage, and wines of distinction. Job Title: Key Account Sales Representative (MUST HAVE STAFFING AGENCY EXPERIENCE)
Job Description:
About the roleYour own customer portfolio. Direct remit for sales and revenue growth. You will serve as an advisor to customers to position Adecco as a workforce specialist and drive brand awareness within industry sectors. You will be responsible for identifying and closing new sales opportunities through your knowledge of the market geography, economic environment, top companies, and competitors in the temporary staffing space. We‚Äôre a united team of people with a collective spirit, working jointly in over 60 countries to help businesses optimize their talent, transform their workforce, and build the lifelong employability of people all over the world.What you‚Äôll be doingYou will serve as a Brand Ambassador and participate in thought leadership activities that build Adecco‚Äôs reputation as the most admired workforce solutions partner. On top of this, you will establish a plan to grow and retain existing accounts and newly acquired clients. Building reliance and credibility amongst clients/prospects, candidates, and colleagues by communicating our value proposition. All while creating an excellent customer experience.Get ready to take talent further as you open up new possibilities for yourself, your team and your clients.About youBachelor's Degree in a business-related disciplineMinimum two years outside sales record with success in exceeding goals & KPIs.Ability to provide strategic, out of the box solutions to our clients, acting as a true consultantAble to set priorities, schedule day‚Äôs events, make cold calls, prepare and give formal presentations.With working knowledge of labor and employment laws.Able to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines and able to handle multiple problems simultaneouslyTeam player, able to establish and maintain effective working relationships.Development of business opportunities.Proficient with Microsoft Office SuiteAble to talk effectively and clearly in writing and orally, both in one-on-one and in group presentation situations.Why choose us?It‚Äôs an exciting time to be part of our team. We‚Äôre proud to be a global thought-leader and care about doing the best job we can to ensure better futures for everyone. We do this by building our Future@Work strategy as a united team of 30,000+ colleagues with a collective spirit working in over 60 countries globally.You‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow across a variety of interesting jobs and careers over our extensive portfolio of global brands. We empower our colleagues to work in the smartest, most efficient ways to achieve total balance between the demands of their jobs and their lives. That‚Äôs why we give you the autonomy and support you need to work in the way that makes you most productive, agile, confident, and insightful.Putting people first, pioneering with a collective spirit and always advancing with a growth mindset -that‚Äôs what we stand for at the Adecco Group. Here, we are all individuals with a unique perspective on the world we live in. That‚Äôs what makes us stronger. Whoever you are and whatever your background, you can be yourself. So, we aim to build on the attributes that make you, you. We offer a range of world-class resources for upskilling and development, satisfying your curiosity while the sharing skills, knowledge, and expertise to grow together. Make an impact where it matters most.A journey to bring out the best in youWe believe that having an understanding of the hiring process helps you to prepare, feel, and be, at your best. As a global, multi brand organization with multiple different roles, our application process can vary.On our career site, you will find some of the key steps you can expect to guide you along the way.As one of the world‚Äôs largest employers we believe in talent, not labels, and focus on the diverse and unique skills our people bring. We seek to foster a culture of belonging and purpose, an environment where everyone can thrive and feel engaged, and where difference is respected and valued. Our commitment to equity, equal opportunity, inclusion, and diversity is part of our broader commitment to respecting fundamental human rights across our value chain. The Adecco Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

About UsAdweek is the leading source of news and insight serving the brand marketing ecosystem. First published in 1979, Adweek's award-winning coverage reaches an engaged audience of more than 6 million professionals across platforms including print, digital, events, podcasts, newsletters, social media and mobile apps. The salary range represents the Company‚Äôs good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting. Actual compensation will be dependent upon a number of factors, including but not limited to, the candidate‚Äôs relevant experience, qualifications, and location. Please note that this role is hybrid, based out of the New York City office and that Adweek is a New York based company and the salary listed reflects candidates located within the New York tri-state area.Medical, Dental & Vision Benefits401K, including Roth, with a discretionary company matchCompany paid Life/AD&D InsuranceUnlimited PTOMandatory Time Off Winter Break ClosureLinkedIn Learning Corporate SubscriptionTuition ReimbursementFree digital/print subscription to Adweek and access to Adweek virtual & digital events!We Are an Equal Opportunity EmployerApplicants and employees are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected Federal, State/Province or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved.

SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.FINANCIAL ANALYSTThe Financial Analyst will be instrumental in the development, tracking, forecasting, reporting and accounting for all SpaceX projects. This is a key financial planning and analysis (FP&A) role with executive level visibility driving spend and contract profitability for all of our product lines, including Starlink, Starship, Falcon, and Dragon. The successful candidate will interface with all aspects of the company, including production, engineering, sales, program management, accounting, and executive management.RESPONSIBILITIES:Lead forecast of key performance indicators (KPIs), including spend and resource requirements for assigned business groups, such as headcount, capital, and operating expensesForecast future unit costs with cross-functional teams and track progress in achieving cost reduction targetsConduct ad-hoc analyses as needed to support operational decision making, from new idea generation through to the implementation phasePerform a leading role on internal projects, working closely with peer organizations to understand key business issues and translate them into financial models and metricsPrepare and update capital expenditure and inventory cash forecastsSupport product cost tracking and inventory analysis, including scrap, inventory obsolescence, and productivity effortsDevelop and enhance tools to track revenue performance and incurred project costs on a monthly basisProvide insight on revenue, spending variances, and department level reporting to business partnersAnalyze and interpret financial data for use in management reviewsBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's degree2+ years of experience in an accounting, finance, or business role (internship experience qualifies) PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's degree in business, finance, economics, or engineeringAdvanced skills in Microsoft Excel, applied business statistics, and general modeling experience of complex non-linear systemsExperience in a manufacturing or technology environmentFamiliarity with reporting, visualization, intelligence, and analysis tools (SQL, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)Strong presentation skills with the ability to regularly interface with executive managementExperience with presenting analytical results in both verbal and written form across a multi-disciplinary organizationAbility to frame unstructured and complex analytical problems to a broad audienceCOMPENSATION & BENEFITS:Pay range:Financial Analyst Level I: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00/per yearFinancial Analyst Level II: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00/per yearYour actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation and will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year. Exempt employees are eligible for 5 days of sick leave per yearITAR REQUIREMENTS:To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here. SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX's Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

Financial Analyst Redeux Energy is seeking a Financial Analyst with strong analytical and modeling skills to evaluate the economics of utility-scale solar and storage renewable energy development projects. The person selected for this role will help maintain our project models, evaluate investment opportunities, and work closely with the leadership team on Redeux‚Äôs corporate financial projections. About Redeux Energy Redeux Energy is an early- to mid-stage utility-scale clean energy development company executing strategies to transform greenfield, brownfield and industrial lands into solar, battery storage, and hybrid projects. Our customers are independent power producers (‚ÄúIPPs‚Äù), utilities, and large industrials who acquire pre-construction projects to build, own and operate.  Redeux is executing a multi-market development plan across the US with a focus on WECC, ERCOT, MISO, SERC, and adjacent regions. In addition to traditional ‚Äúgreenfield‚Äù project development, Redeux targets brownfield redevelopment opportunities to transition fossil to clean-energy solutions that utilize existing infrastructure while reducing liabilities of legacy operations.  Redeux‚Äôs leadership team brings decades and gigawatts of experience in solar and storage project development, offtake origination, financing, engineering, construction, and operations. We are comprised of senior talent from leading renewable industry companies including AES, Acciona, Avangrid, Borrego, EDPR, NextEra, National Grid, RES, Scout Clean Energy, Tesla, CLS and KPMG.  This is a unique opportunity to join a well-capitalized, high-growth, industry-leading development platform.  Position Responsibilities:The Financial Analyst will collaborate with multiple cross-functional teams (Land, Development, Corporate Development, and Market Strategy) as well as externally with consultants, banks, and potential partners. This position is based at Redeux‚Äôs headquarters in Denver, Colorado, and reports to the VP of Finance.Develop and maintain financial models and analysis for renewable energy projects.Assist in building models, tools, process, and infrastructure that supports the organization's accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.Work across internal departments, external consultants, and stakeholders to organize key inputs.Review and assist with negotiating term sheets and definitive documentation by converting terms into modeled project analyses.Develop and deliver internal / external investment presentations and briefs.Assist in preparation of corporate budgets, forecasts, and analyses.Prepare ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù financial analyses and sensitivities to support a variety of development and corporate decisions and negotiations.Support senior team members in the structuring, negotiating, and execution of transactions.Qualifications:Our ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience in the renewable energy industry working with project finance models, including modeling tax equity and debt structures. The candidate has extensive experience using Excel and has a solid understanding of financial concepts such as time value of money, internal rate of return, cash flow analysis, debt, and tax credits. Key qualifications as follows:Expertise in tax equity modeling including capital accounts, depreciation, and buyouts (preferred)Exceptional analytical skills and understanding of relevant financial and mathematical modeling techniques.Strong quantitative aptitude with an extremely high level of attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to express ideas effectively and fluently.Ability to synthesize and organize large amounts of data.A strong sense of personal responsibility and ownership of work products.Entrepreneurial, ownership-minded professional with a strong interest in supporting renewable development growth.Self-motivated and driven with a high level of initiative and creative problem-solving skills.Able to thrive in a fast-paced business environment and manage multiple projects with competing deadlinesAbility to work collaboratively with cross-functional teamsBachelor's degree with high academic achievement; Master's degree, CFA and/or CPA a plus.Highly proficient in MS Excel, MS Word, and MS PowerPoint Culture and Compensation Redeux Energy is building an entrepreneurial team with a culture of accountability, integrity, innovation, and drive. We offer pay commensurate with experience along with excellent benefits including:Performance-based, incentive planCompetitive benefits package including dental, vision, health401(k) plan with company match and immediate vestingFlexible work schedules and time-off policies

Job DescriptionAs the Senior Financial Analyst, this position plays a pivotal role in ensuring that the company has accurate reporting, insightful analysis, which contributes directly to leadership decision-making and company growth and success. This role reports directly to the CFO and will be responsible for creating models, preparing financial reports and presentations for the board of directors.This position requires a strong analytical background with the ability to analyze and consolidate financial results for reporting to high-level management. Job DescriptionCompany:PBS BiotechDepartment:Human ResourcesPosition/Title:Executive Director of Human ResourcesLocation:Camarillo, CA 93012No Relocation Assistance ProvidedReporting To:VP of Human ResourcesFLSA Status:ExemptSalary Range:$200k - $240k - $280kGENERAL PURPOSEPBS Biotech, Inc. is a fast-growing private company based in Camarillo, CA that manufactures and sells the most advanced single-use bioreactors for the biopharmaceutical market. We are seeking a highly motivated Executive Director of Human Resources to join us in our important mission. The Executive Director of Human Resources will directly be responsible for the Human Resources Business Partner client supporting organization. They will be directly involved in the Human Resources strategy that includes transforming the organization and enabling growth to meet expanding business needs. Assist in providing guidance and leadership with all aspects of organizational development. Assist in the review and upgrade where appropriate all internal HR systems, processes, and staff to maximize Human Resources capital opportunity as well as customer satisfaction. Advise client leaders on organization design and development, workforce planning and talent needs, align strategic imperatives and organization goals.Working through Human Resources team to develop, guide and manage the human resources services, policies and programs for PBS Biotech including recruitment and staffing, performance management, employee and leadership development and training, regulatory compliance, employee orientation, policy development and documentation, employee relations, employee communication, compensation and benefits administration, employee activities and events, and employee wellness and health. Implement and drive a state-of-the-art working environment, ensuring employee satisfaction while providing a competitive business environment the cultivates an environment of teamwork and collaboration.ResponsibilitiesEssential functions of the job are listed below. Other responsibilities may also be assigned. Please note that the essential functions may vary depending on department size, organizational structure and/or geographic location. Reasonable accommodations may be made to allow differently-abled individuals to perform the essential functions of the job.Assist in driving Human Resources strategy to ensure optimal performance in support of company strategy.Maintain understanding of county, state, and federal laws as they pertain to organizational compliance and both short and long-term strategy.Assist in the creation of Human Resources metrics and drive People excellence through meeting and exceeding goals as they relate to PBS Biotech culture and employee excellence.Foster business partner relationships with BPS Biotech leaders to support direction and contribute to short and long-term strategy.Working in alliance with leadership fosters a culture of strong work ethic and integrity.Assist in the development and implementation of Human Resources policies and procedures and ensure compliance with applicable legal provisions. Assist management with informing staff and enforcing these provisions.Assist in the development and implementation of benefit and compensation short and long-term strategies that ensure support of company culture and alignment with government regulations.Educate and provide transparency as appropriate to all levels of the organization to foster and support an environment of trust and security.Implement effective training programs that encourage retention, growth, and opportunity.Support Human Resources staff to understand and manage employee relations issues, including discipline and people performance conferring on issues related to employment with PBS Biotech.Provide coaching for individual leaders to improve their leadership competency.Network with a variety of vendors, professional organizations, and thought leaders to stay abreast of tools, resources, and products that heighten the level of talent development within the company.Work with leadership to drive the employee survey process including administration, analysis, reporting and improvement activities.Strong at process management to ensure consistent application.Plan and coordinate effective training programs and workshops.Advise senior leaders as a business partner.Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.Think strategically to align development efforts with business needs.Assist in driving Human Resources strategy to ensure optimal performance in support of company strategy.Maintain understanding of county, state, and federal laws as they pertain to organizational compliance and both short and long-term strategy.Assist in the creation of Human Resources metrics and drive People excellence through meeting and exceeding goals as they relate to PBS Biotech culture and employee excellence.Minimum QualificationsThe following are the minimum qualifications that an individual needs in order to successfully perform the duties and responsibilities of this position. Please note that the minimum qualifications may vary based upon the department size and/or geographic location.Skills/ Abilities Pertinent To This PositionLeadership - Ability to influence others to perform their jobs effectively and to be responsible for making decisions.Deep experience in Employee Relations, Training and development, Compensation, Strategic planning and Recruiting. Benefits expertise a plus.Management Skills - Ability to organize and direct oneself and effectively supervise others.Diversity Oriented - Ability to collaborate effectively with people at all levels and backgrounds in the organization.Relationship Building - Ability to effectively build relationships with customers and co-workers.Business Acumen - Ability to grasp and understand business concepts and issues.Coaching and Development - Ability to provide guidance and feedback to help others strengthen specific knowledge/skill areas.Ethical - Ability to demonstrate conduct conforming to a set of values and accepted standards.Presentation Skills - Ability to effectively present information publicly.Education / ExperienceBachelor‚Äôs degree required; master‚Äôs degree or MBA preferred.15+ years of Human Resources experience specific to pharmaceutical/biotech industry.10+ years of successful leadership experienceStrong understanding of the biotechnology industryExperience in start-up, growing company is a plus.Some experience presenting to a Board of Directors and articulating short-term and long-term goals and strategies is preferred.SHRM Certification is a plus.Effective communication and training techniques.Effective management principles related to recruitment, selection, employee relations, classification, compensation, HRIS and retirement programs.Laws pertaining to employment, such as equal opportunity, workers‚Äô compensation, fair employment, disabilities accommodations, discrimination, harassment, and environment.Staffing and positions utilized in the health care field, particularly in a managed care organization.Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies.Resources available to meet training needs and techniques for evaluating and assessing ability to perform.Strength in strategy, teamwork, short and long-term planning, team building.Organizational development principles and practical work force applicationsComputer Skills: Advanced computer skills included in the MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint).Certifications & Licenses: SHRM certifications a plus or six sigma experiencePHYSICAL DEMANDSIn general, the following physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Job Title: Director of Human ResourcesLocation: Washington D.C.Compensation and Benefits: $130k - $140kAbout LGC:LGC places professionals (like you!) with businesses in the hospitality industry who are looking to grow their teams on a permanent basis. As a candidate, we‚Äôll work closely with you to learn about your employment goals and help you decide what you want for the next step in your career. Then, we‚Äôll match you with the client (and position) that best meets your needs.Since 2003 LGC has been building connections between businesses with staffing needs and job seekers looking for new opportunities. Our range of solutions include temporary and permanent placements (and everything in between) in a variety of industries. With offices located nationwide, we can tap into a dynamic pool of talented professionals. We have a passion for creating partnerships that last and work hard every day to ensure both clients and candidates reach their employment goals.LGC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.Client Information and Job Description:Our client is in search of our next Director of Human Resources who is an experienced professional with knowledge of all matters relating to Human Resources: recruitment, hiring, benefits, training, employee relations, labor relations, union, engagement, health, safety and compliance with both federal and state laws working within a hotel.The responsibilities and qualifications for a Director of Human Resources position at a hotel can vary depending on the size and nature of the hotel, but here are some general guidelines:Responsibilities:Strategic HR Management: Develop and implement HR strategies and policies that align with the hotel's business goals and objectives. This includes workforce planning, talent acquisition, and succession planning.Recruitment and Staffing: Oversee the recruitment process, including job postings, interviewing, and selection of candidates. Ensure the hotel has a well-qualified and diverse workforce.Training and Development: Identify training needs, create and implement training programs for staff at all levels, and promote a culture of continuous learning.Employee Relations: Address employee concerns and grievances, mediate conflicts, and foster a positive work environment. Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations.Compensation and Benefits: Administer compensation and benefits programs, including salary reviews, bonuses, and benefits packages. Monitor market trends to remain competitive.Performance Management: Implement performance appraisal systems and work with department heads to establish and monitor performance metrics and goals.Compliance: Ensure compliance with labor laws, health and safety regulations, and other HR-related legal requirements.Diversity and Inclusion: Promote diversity and inclusion in the workplace, ensuring equal opportunities and fair treatment for all employees.Conflict Resolution: Handle employee disputes and grievances and ensure that appropriate conflict resolution processes are in place.Qualifications:Experience: Several years of progressive HR experience, including at least a few years in a supervisory or managerial role. EXPERIENCE IN HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY REQUIRED.Knowledge of Labor Laws: Strong knowledge of labor laws and regulations, including those specific to the hospitality industry. UNION and AAP EXPERIENCE REQUIRED.Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with employees, management, and external parties.Problem-Solving: The ability to identify and solve complex HR-related issues and conflicts.Leadership Skills: Strong leadership and team management skills to lead the HR department effectively.Organizational Skills: Effective organizational and time management skills to handle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.Ethical Conduct: High ethical standards and the ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.

Your ensure these values are reflected in service the excellent, warm, personalized attention that you give our customers each dayWHO YOU AREYou enjoy good food and delicious coffeeYou enjoy interacting with a wide range of people ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs the CEO of a small company or the facility manager of a large corporation.You are customer-oriented, and you enjoy finding creative and individual solutions according to the needs of your client.You are happy to be out and about, meeting clients in the field, and you enjoy variety in your work daysYou are a team player with a positive attitude and customer-centric mindset, and flexibility is one of your strengths.You have a minimum two years of professional experience in B2B sales, ideally in food, beverage and/or hospitalityYou are a strong communicator verbally and in writing.You are authorized to work in the United States. Currently, FELFEL does not provide visa sponsorship. All applicants must be able to provide legal proof of their eligibility to work in the U.S.OUR BENEFITSLots of delicious food in our own office FELFEL fridge ‚Äì who says there‚Äôs no such thing as a free lunch?!The finest Italian coffee and tea, thanks to our carefully selected Fair Trade coffee beans, roasted exclusively for us in Italy and paired with our custom developed espresso machine and line of teas.Exciting and convenient location: Our office is located in the heart of New York City in Flatiron within easy access to public transit, the Union Square Greenmarket, Eataly and other sources of culinary inspiration, culture and fun.Hybrid work: We believe in the powerful productivity, connectivity and collegiality of working together and enjoying meals together in person and you‚Äôll find us in the office ~4 days per week.Remote work: Two weeks per year to work remote from anywhere in the world, including in our head office in Switzerland or anywhere in the world with solid internet connectivity AND if/when your role & responsibilities can be effectively executed remotely.And more great benefits: Our thoughtfully composed full range of benefits reflect how we value our team members. In addition to generous paid time off, flexible holidays, and delicious food, we offer comprehensive healthcare insurance options, including some that cost less than $20/month, a retirement/401K plan and a range of other benefits: commuter transit FSA, life insurance, long & short-term disability, access to mental health support, financial advisers, healthcare concierge services and more. We also offer paid parental leave, opportunities for professional development, on-the-job training with cross-functional and even cross-regional career growth opportunities with our team in Europe. We love to gather, connect and celebrate our team members, hard work, accomplishments with events and recognition throughout the year.If this sounds like the job for you, then APPLY NOW and send us a short 1min Video (via Wetransfer or similar to jointheteam@felfel.com OR via whatsapp to +41 79 678 41 79) explaining, why you are the right candidate for this position and what fascinates you most about the role and FELFEL! You build strong and lasting relationships with our corporate clients and ensure that they are happy and satisfied with our services, and that we are their favorite lunch option.YOUR RESPONSIBILITIESB2B Client relationship management ‚Äì you are the first and last point-of-contact for clients, and you are constantly working to deepen your relationship with our customers and the value you provide to themYou have strategic insight into your own clients and thus create and execute targeted development strategies to achieve growth, retention and other team goals.You work in close collaboration with the Sales team to generate new leadsYou launch new clients / offices including the preparation, coordination and execution in partnership with our customers and with various internal teams.You organize events with customers, including of course a really energetic and effective launch event. They you and closely monitor and check in with clients during their trial phase / first year with FELFELYou process daily requests from your stakeholders/owners at each client/potential client. This could be done via e-mail, phone, or directly by meeting at the client site.Overall you understand customer needs and issues, and develop individual and creative solutions, where needed.Represent our FELFEL brand and values: You lead by example and represent FELFEL values and our brand promise with clients, business partners and also internal team members. Your ensure these values are reflected in service the excellent, warm, personalized attention that you give our customers each dayWHO YOU AREYou enjoy good food and delicious coffeeYou enjoy interacting with a wide range of people ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs the CEO of a small company or the facility manager of a large corporation.You are customer-oriented, and you enjoy finding creative and individual solutions according to the needs of your client.You are happy to be out and about, meeting clients in the field, and you enjoy variety in your work daysYou are a team player with a positive attitude and customer-centric mindset, and flexibility is one of your strengths.You have a minimum two years of professional experience in B2B sales, ideally in food, beverage and/or hospitalityYou are a strong communicator verbally and in writing.You are authorized to work in the United States. Currently, FELFEL does not provide visa sponsorship. All applicants must be able to provide legal proof of their eligibility to work in the U.S.OUR BENEFITSLots of delicious food in our own office FELFEL fridge ‚Äì who says there‚Äôs no such thing as a free lunch?!The finest Italian coffee and tea, thanks to our carefully selected Fair Trade coffee beans, roasted exclusively for us in Italy and paired with our custom developed espresso machine and line of teas.Exciting and convenient location: Our office is located in the heart of New York City in Flatiron within easy access to public transit, the Union Square Greenmarket, Eataly and other sources of culinary inspiration, culture and fun.Hybrid work: We believe in the powerful productivity, connectivity and collegiality of working together and enjoying meals together in person and you‚Äôll find us in the office ~4 days per week.Remote work: Two weeks per year to work remote from anywhere in the world, including in our head office in Switzerland or anywhere in the world with solid internet connectivity AND if/when your role & responsibilities can be effectively executed remotely.And more great benefits: Our thoughtfully composed full range of benefits reflect how we value our team members. In addition to generous paid time off, flexible holidays, and delicious food, we offer comprehensive healthcare insurance options, including some that cost less than $20/month, a retirement/401K plan and a range of other benefits: commuter transit FSA, life insurance, long & short-term disability, access to mental health support, financial advisers, healthcare concierge services and more. We also offer paid parental leave, opportunities for professional development, on-the-job training with cross-functional and even cross-regional career growth opportunities with our team in Europe. We love to gather, connect and celebrate our team members, hard work, accomplishments with events and recognition throughout the year.If this sounds like the job for you, then APPLY NOW and send us a short 1min Video (via Wetransfer or similar to jointheteam@felfel.com OR via whatsapp to +41 79 678 41 79) explaining, why you are the right candidate for this position and what fascinates you most about the role and FELFEL! DescriptionHiredScore is the leading provider of Talent Orchestration technology. HiredScore‚Äôs artificial intelligence, automation, and deep integrations empower the largest and most innovative companies in the world to safely and transparently drive critical business outcomes in recruitment productivity, diversity hiring, internal mobility, and total talent management.HiredScore‚Äôs proprietary technology provides compliant-by-design AI that seamlessly connects to data and systems to power the shift to proactive and fair HR decisions. HiredScore is live in 150 countries and available in 70 languages.We‚Äôre looking for a highly driven, results-oriented Customer Success Manager to join our growing Customer Success Team in the US. Our Customer Success Team is the face of HiredScore to our customers and they reflect the ‚Äúvoice of the customer‚Äù internally to all cross-functional teams within the organization. They interact directly with our largest clients and stakeholders, facilitate product training for end-users, drive user engagement and adoption, and work with our Product, Marketing, Data Science, Engineering, and Delivery and Revenue teams to identify opportunities for innovation and bring to market new products and capabilities that deliver even more value for our clients. Our CS Team is tasked with ensuring our product remains the best in the industry and that its value and business impact are accurately reflected.The position is located in New York, Hybrid workplace Model, Expected travel between 10-15%.Roles & ResponsibilitiesDevelop, maintain, and own relationships with existing clients to ensure success, satisfaction, and long-term retention. Work cross-functionally with Delivery, Product, Data Science, BI, and Engineering Teams and customer Success Managers to identify opportunities and communicate insights and feedback from our customers to the rest of the company.Define user engagement strategy and execution for your clients in order to grow customers‚Äô adoption of our solution and continuous improvement of customer experience.Own user onboarding, training, and feedback. Own coordination of feedback to drive product enhancements with both internal and external client stakeholders. Understand client KPIs and goals for product utilization and collaborate with clients to achieve these goals.What You Need4+ years of experience working in a B2B SaaS company as a Customer Success, Account Manager, or Technical Account Manager Experience working with enterprise F500 customersSU experience is a must!Proven track record of working with end users to drive user adoption of products, services, or technologiesExceptional collaboration and communication skills, and the ability to balance customer priorities while maintaining strong cross-functional relationships internally.Results-oriented with a strong track record for success in delivering business objectives with the ability to self-manage and execute projects from scratchExcellent presentation and project management skills, while working in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with multiple, concurrent prioritiesStrong analytical experience working with business intelligence and data platforms for customer analysis.Willingness to work flexible hours, as needed, with a global team and customer base.Salary Range:HiredScore‚Äôs Annual salary range for this position is $100,000 - $125,000 OTE. This salary range may include multiple levels. Your level is based on our assessment of your interview performance and experience. Salary is just one component of HiredScore's total compensation package for employees.Your total rewards package at HiredScore will include equity, Comprehensive Health Care Coverage for Medical, Dental, and Vision for our Employees and Families, 401(k) with a company matching program, Paid Parental Leave programs, vacation, and Sick days policy to encourage a healthy work-life balance, Welfare activities, and many other region-specific benefits, In addition, you will have access to a global team of talented professionals.We are growing and offer many opportunities to make your mark!ADVANTAGESPortugueseExperience in an HR technology company, especially in recruiting and talent is preferredExperience working with CS tools: Planhat/Gainsight, and/or BI tools: Looker, Mixpanel

Customer Success Manager - Advertising/Marketing TechnologySurfside is an end-to-end marketing technology that aggregates first-party data across all customer touchpoints, allowing advertisers the ability to better understand, target, and measure how to influence current and future customers. We work with many clients and advertisers across different verticals and have a core focus in the Cannabis industry as we bring unique technology to a complex and massive vertical. We are looking for innovative, action-oriented professionals with the desire and initiative to make a major impact for the leading technology platform in the Cannabis space as we continue to expand within Cannabis and to other verticals.The Opportunity:At Surfside, the work environment is collaborative, fast-paced and team-driven. We are currently seeking a Customer Success Manager to focus on senior-level client relationships, analyze and optimize campaign performance, strategically manage and upsell key accounts, and lead complex processes and organizational workflows in our Operations department. We're looking for a highly motivated and experienced individual, who is ready to roll up their sleeves, think outside the box, and help lead our account management, sales and measurement efforts across the US.This role is core to maintaining existing accounts and assisting with campaign implementation and reporting. You will work closely with sales, clients, ad ops and engineering to help support our rapid client and revenue growth. Your core focus will be on acting as the main point of contact between ad operations and clientele with your product expertise and real-time knowledge on live campaigns within the Surfside platform to ensure revenue growth and platform adoption. You will be responsible for developing reporting materials, optimization reports and business reviews that exhibit and inform our clients how to best utilize the Surfside technology to meet and exceed their KPIs. The ideal candidate works well in groups, is a creative thinker, organized, and committed to excellence in customer service.Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Lead, manage, and proactively grow relationships with key clients and agency partnersHelp onboard new account managers and account specialists, ensuring they understand best practices and key cross-functional relationshipsLead internal workflows and processes to maintain internal metrics and business dashboardsDive deep into campaign performance data; guide KPI driven measurement strategies, identify performance trends, optimize campaigns to achieve results, and provide recommendations for upsell opportunitiesIncrease adoption and engagement of Surfside's self-service platform providing ongoing technical support and real time analysisProactively develop best-in-class case studies that deliver a constantly evolving test-and-learn agenda across the categoryAbility to understand data and trends to ‚Äútell a story‚Äù to a client through reportable insights, case studies, and optimization recommendationsRecognize upsell opportunities; lead and influence clients to invest when opportunities ariseSupport Sales throughout campaign process by being active participant on client meetings for reporting updates, business reviews and campaign performanceDevelop a strong understanding of Surfside's value proposition and become an expert in our product offering (current and future)Requirements:2+ years experience in digital advertising, specifically programmatic advertising, focused on account management, customer success, reporting and client servicesBachelor's degree or equivalent experienceStrong organizational, presentation project management, and communication skillsAdvanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, as well as experience with analyzing datasets and delivering actionable insightsIncredibly data driven, with deep understanding of advertising performance metricsPassion for technology, media measurement, programmatic advertising and consumer insightsSelf driven and motivated; ability to handle multiple projects at onceWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
