POSITION SUMMARYThe Graphic Designer will be responsible for facilitating the design process for Cardone Ventures by ensuring that designs are in keeping with the brand's DNA. This includes managing the creative process from start to finish: defining concepts, designing, sketching, and some development.The Graphic Designer must possess an extensive skill set and qualifications that work together to manage the design process efficiently. This position supports the mission of the organization by demonstrating excellent designs that are compelling to potential customers while also serving the design needs of our internal team to support existing clients.ABOUT CARDONE VENTURESOur mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.OBJECTIVESStudy design briefs and company brand to determine requirements Incorporate brand values into content, and direct high-quality creative and brand design Develop illustrations, logos and other content using design software Leverage knowledge of the latest trends in new media, video, television, design, advertising, and marketing in order to inform creative campaigns Develop assets for social media engagement Develop assets for websites that will lead to a higher conversion Create supporting graphics across various media for A/B testing (social, web, etc.) Execute through all design phases, mainly front-end development Utilize GIF/sticker content types and creation techniques - animation, stop motion, video, etc. (if necessary) Create highly engaging/persuasive graphic designs for all platforms (social media, website, email‚Ä¶etc)COMPETENCIESProficient in Adobe Creative Cloud Suite and Sketch Proficient in major web based "Drag & Drop" web development programs Ability to expand and build upon a simple creative brief Ability to read creative briefs and convert to functional designBackground in Keynote, Google Suite, Powerpoint, and Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, After Effects, Illustrator, Premiere, and Animate) Understanding of management, transcription, and other administrative proceduresDemonstrates a focus on creating assets that convert, rather than solely focusing on aesthetics (Functional Design) Understanding of conversion statistics and KPIs in order to enhance designs to meet goalsUnderstanding of print production and how to submit files to vendors to ensure quality productionBasic knowledge of ClickFunnels softwareEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEAt least 5 years of relevant industry experience (branded content/new media/creative production)Digital or Graphic Design degree preferredPHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computerCOMMITMENT TO DIVERSITYAs an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include the job title and source where you found this position in the subject line of your email to careers @cardoneventures.com. Already a Cardone Ventures candidate? Please connect directly with your recruiter to discuss this opportunity.

CHAOS Inc. is a global technology company that is delivering next generation capabilities to the defense and critical industrial sectors. Founded in 2022 by a seasoned leadership team, CHAOS has quickly become the place where world-class multi-disciplinary engineers come to build mission-critical technologies. CHAOS has a mission-focused culture, dedicated to solving the toughest technical challenges. Its unique agile engineering approach enables rapid prototyping, while deep partnerships with defense and industry ensure real-world solutions.Graphic Designer OverviewAs a Graphic Designer, you will play a vital role in creating visually-engaging designs and graphics that effectively convey complex information, concepts, and technical data, all which support the look/feel of the brand. As a strong communicator, you will work with cross-functional teams of engineers, designers, and subject matter experts, rapidly iterating on ideas, addressing points of feedback, and finding compelling visual solutions. Project types include: slide decks, technical diagrams, illustrations, graphics, branding, layout and website design.Graphic Designer ResponsibilitiesCreate visually-compelling graphics, illustrations, and visual assets for various projects, slide decks, proposals, marketing materials, and digital mediaCreate systems and templates that help support our business development teams and increase the quality of future projects.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather project requirements, feedback, and technical details to ensure accurate and effective design solutionsTransform complex technical data and information into clear and engaging visual representations, such as infographics and diagramsExercise judgment and project management skills to balance priorities and communicate with teams to meet or exceed project deadlines; keep internal clients informed on projects and progressEnsure the accuracy, consistency, and quality of all design work producedDevelop long-term design strategies, staying ahead of the curve on design technologies and how they can be applied to the needs of the teamPartner and embed closely with engineers, designers, and stakeholders to iterate on new concepts and effectively communicate messagingMinimum Qualifications3-5 years professional experience in Brand DesignAbility to provide access to your portfolio demonstrating strong familiarity with a range of compositionsAbility to transform complex ideas into compelling narrativesA mastery of design, typography, color theory, illustration, composition, and formFluency in Adobe Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, etc.)Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and adapt to shifting prioritiesStrong communication skillsAbility to work onsite 5 days per week from our Hermosa Beach officePreferred QualificationsBachelors degree in a related fieldUI/UX experienceExperience with 3D software (3DS Max, V-Ray, Unreal Engine)U.S. Person statusSalary range $80,000-$100,000/yearThe salary range for this role is an estimate based on a range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Chaos also offers top-tier benefits, including comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, employee life and disability, mental health and family planning benefits, with all premiums paid by Chaos. Chaos provides fully paid medical leave, paid company holidays, and un-capped paid time off. Chaos is an equal-opportunity employer, committed to fostering a diverse workplace. üö® Notice üö®Movers+Shakers is amongst one of the many companies being used in a recruiting scam. We deeply regret any inconvenience caused to you by this fraudulent activity and want to assure you that our legitimate recruiters will only contact you through official moversshakers.co email addresses.We'd never offer a role to someone without having several video interviews with the team. Furthermore, it is important to note that our recruiters will never request any monetary transactions from you.Want to help grow the #1 "Fastest-Growing Agency"? Want to join a company whose brand is so strong that we get unsolicited clients reaching out every day? Want to help define the future of social media marketing?Movers+Shakers is a new kind of agency built for the era of lo-fi, authentic social. We act as a creative AOR, influencer agency, and production house -- streamlined to drive cultural relevance with Gen Z and Millennials.Brands like e.l.f., Netflix, Dove, Red Bull, and Tinder rely on Movers+Shakers to win on social and beyond. We've gotten our clients over 250 billion views on social -- from major brand moments to viral daily content.The hype doesn't stop with our clients' brands. Fast Company named Movers+Shakers one of the "Most Innovative Companies" in the world, and AdAge named us a "Small Agency of the Year" (three years in a row). Adweek called us, "the best agency in the world at creating campaigns on TikTok."We're really proud of our work, and we're even more proud of our culture. In their first week, new employees inevitably comment on how positive and supportive our workplace is. A month in, they're noting how little ego there is, and how departments collaborate surprisingly deeply. We only work with brands that share our commitment to spreading joy, and we have parted ways with client teams that don't treat our team with respect.Intrigued? Read on‚Ä¶REMOTE-FIRST CULTURE! Work from anywhere in the US! Home, WeWork, your mom's house, you choose! Our team is 100% remote-first, with hubs in LA and NYC. All employees can have an All-Access WeWork Pass to collaborate with teammates in your area or to simply change up your working environment. Strong & tight-knit culture important to you? Us too! We've always been remote-first, and we've built a thriving culture. From zoom coffees to in-person hangouts, we thrive as a connected team. Most positions require some travel or time on site because of the needs of the role. For example: team meetings, client meetings, on-site production. Talk to your recruiter for more info!THE ROLEWe're looking for self-starters, makers, doers, and creative visionaries to dream up and lead disruptive and groundbreaking marketing. We're looking for people who share our mission to spread joy.The ideal candidate is obsessed with culture and insights with a social-first aesthetic and an agency background. You love to create social assets, obsess over crafting comps that tell a story, have mastered the art of creating engaging presentations, and stay current with design trends across social and the larger design world. The Graphic Designer can take projects from concept through final execution, is comfortable working at the speed of social, and stays organized across multiple ongoing projects at once. You're an expert in Adobe CC, dabble in Canva, have some experience with animation and are hungry for the opportunity to make attention-grabbing work that connects authentically with culture. You'll be working on organic brand channels, viral content ideas, headline-grabbing projects, and more.This person has a background in creating reactive and organic content at a creative agency, lives for the social buzz, focuses on customer engagement, intuits client needs, develops & delivers killer proposals, and orchestrates home-run projects that leave clients begging for more. You have extensive experience across social media, a track record of disruptive brand marketing, and a bent to building creative solutions based around cultural trends.ResponsibilitiesConcept and design for social content, marketing collateral and other disruptive cross-channel executions alongside our copywriters, strategy, and account teamsCreate amazing comps, branding and assets, presentation decks, illustrations and animations that bring the work to lifeHave a passion for design, culture, art, and musicIdentify current and new trends and content opportunities on socialActively participate in internal meetings by contributing concept and design ideas, as well as iterating and expanding on established directionsEmbrace M+S's approach to creative disruptionBecome a world leader in organic social-first marketing, and lead brands to cultural relevancePartner with the copywriting and strategy team to see the creative vision carried through to deliveryDesign Movers+Shakers branded assets, marketing collateral, and social media contentProvide quality assurance on creative deliverablesBuild and maintain a good rapport with the creative team, strategists, account managers, producers, and leadershipQualifications2-4 years of graphic design experience at a creative agency, design studio or similar setting. Experience designing for social platforms, establishing and evolving design systems, creating presentation decks, comps, templates and layouts. Ability to uphold brand guidelines with a strong eye for design. Obsessed with details!Exceptional eye for detail and trained in typography, layout and color theory. Comfortable working across different social channels while building and maintaining consistency,Experience working under pressure and ability to simultaneously handle a wide range of assets, tasks and projects. Passion for delighting clients and going above & beyond. Strong verbal, presentation, and interpersonal communications skills. Expert proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Canva, and Google Slides. Motion experience and proficiency in After Effects is a big plus. Deep understanding (and obsession) with entertainment and social storytelling formats of today, such as TikTok, and a high interest in new and emerging social platforms. A low interest in traditional mediaSpread Joy! ‚ú®BASE SALARY RANGEOur estimated range for this role is $70,000-80,000* Don't let this range drive your decision to apply. Actual compensation packages are based on the level of skill and experience each candidate brings to their role. Similarly, there might also be a more senior or junior position available, that would be a better fit with your expertise. For example, a person may apply for a Senior Creative Producer role, and we may assess that their skills are at the Creative Producer level. Each level has its own compensation range. At Movers+Shakers, we pride ourselves on competitive salaries, and we work hard to ensure there is pay equity across the company. We welcome open and honest conversations about compensation in all of our initial calls. We look forward to meeting you!

Job Title: Associate Graphic Designer - Magazine DesignFull-time in person position with a salary of $45,000-$55,000Position Overview:As an Associate Graphic Designer specializing in magazine design, you will play a pivotal role in bringing our publications to life. Job Summary: Coyuchi is looking for a Junior Graphic Designer to join our dynamic and creative team. Reporting to the Senior Graphic Designer, the ideal candidate will have a passion for design and a strong understanding of print and digital mediums. The Junior Graphic Designer will be responsible for collaborating with the Senior Graphic Designer to create visually appealing designs that meet Coyuchi's needs. The candidate will also be tasked with developing design concepts and executing them into finished products for various mediums, including print and digital.Working closely with project managers, the Junior Graphic Designer will ensure that design projects are completed on time and within budget while participating in design reviews with other members of the creative team. Additionally, you will stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and software updates, bringing fresh ideas and innovation to the team.The Junior Graphic Designer role requires a collaborative and detail-oriented team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment.Responsibilities:Design and develop digital assets including website landing pages, digital ads, email, video and other web assets. Occasionally assist in the development of print collateral including direct mail pieces, print ads, signage, and packaging. Create design ideas and transform them into completed projects. Work with project managers to ensure that design projects are completed on time and within budget. Participate in design reviews and provide feedback to other members of the creative team. Stay up-to-date with design trends and software updates. Requirements:2+ years of experience in graphic design or a related field. Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Figma, Asana, and Canva. Experience in AfterEffects is a plus. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously. Attention to detail and ability to produce high-quality work. Bachelor's degree in graphic design or a related field preferred. If you're a motivated and ambitious Junior Graphic Designer who is passionate about design and is looking to grow your skills, we invite you to apply and join the Coyuchi family.To apply for the Junior Graphic Designer position, interested candidates should submit their resume, cover letter, and a portfolio or work samples that showcase their design skills and experience.The portfolio should include a range of design projects, both digital and print, that demonstrate the candidate's ability to develop creative concepts, design layouts, and use design software effectively. We will review all applications and contact qualified candidates for an interview.Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the salary for this role is $65,000 annually.The salary offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors including but not limited to market location, job-related knowledge, education/training, certifications, key skills, experience, external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment. In compliance with the California Law, a potential new employee's salary history will not be used in compensation decisions. e.l.f. is for every eye, lip, and face, providing access to the best of beauty. We are seeking a highly skilled and creative designer with a passion for beauty and the expertise to meet design direction within brand, manufacturing and cost constraints. This fast-paced role handles multiple projects on escalated timelines, requiring a nimble designer capable of quick pivots and strategic thinking. Communicate information clearly and effectively with team members across multiple time zones, including team members in China.Ability to meet stringent deadlines, quickly managing changing prioritiesStrong knowledge of sustainability best practicesStrong knowledge of beauty trendsAbility to anticipate workload and communicate proactively to Project ManagerRequirementsBachelor‚Äôs Degree in Graphic Design, Packaging Design, Visual Communications, or a related field.5+ years experience as a packaging designer in a high volume, deadline-driven environment in beauty or a related industry, with a strong portfolioProficient in industry-standard design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign)Excellent communication, time management and organizational skills, deadline driven.Comfortable working in a collaborative manner and a highly creative out-of-the-box thinkerCurrent on fashion, beauty, design and digital trendsExperience in art direction for beauty a plusThis job description is intended to describe the general nature, and level of work being performed in this position. SpiderOak is committed to building secure and reliable software that protects our customers‚Äô data. Our approach is fundamentally different from most mainstream security companies. Instead of adding layers of security on top of an insecure system, we build software that is inherently secure.SpiderOak builds need-to-know technology that supports customers working in hostile environments. We offer the most patient-centric, individualized, flexible and compassionate care. Our mission is to partner with our patients to help them achieve their goals, whatever those may be. We believe everyone deserves a family if they want one, and our team is dedicated to guiding our patients on their unique journeys!Why should you join our team?We are a mission-driven organization that is looking for high performers, movers, shakers and innovators! We are working hard to create a first-class fertility practice, but we know how to have fun too! We are growing quickly and care deeply about the development of our team, both professionally and personally. We value optimism, compassion and teamwork, and above all, are united by our shared commitment to put patients first.Role SummaryThe IT Support Tech is responsible for proactively and reactively handling the technology needs and requirements of Doctors, Nurses, Medical Assistants and Finance/Administrative departments. This position mandates a high level of interaction and engagement with senior executives, doctors, and a growing staff base, working in a fast-paced and dynamic organization. The role is responsible for all technology support; including but not limited to, installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of a wide range of technologies including desktops, laptops, audio/video, mobile devices, Meraki networking, cloud technologies and specific medical-related devices and applications.Day-to-Day Job Duties Include:Provide IT support to a growing staff of 300+ people consisting of Doctors, Nurses, Medical Assistants and Finance/Administrative departments. Identify and pursue new and innovative ways to improve processes, delivery of support, and technology solutions in general. High level of customer focus with due care and attention to priority issues. Assist with the on-boarding process, prepping and deploying systems, as well as training and educating new hires during IT orientations. Manage our asset life cycle and IT procurement process, maintaining hardware inventory, accurate cycle counts, and decommissioning processes. Help to evaluate hardware and software solutions and participate in IT projects. Resolve technical problems with LAN, WAN, VPN, WiFi, Print Servers and other back-office systems. Oversee, support and troubleshoot our A/V conferencing systems in multiple conference rooms/offices. Generate/Track/Close tickets for all IT related issues in a timely and consistent manner as defined by our SLA policies while maintaining a positive customer satisfaction rating. Work closely with 3rd party vendors providing various technology services. Work closely and actively as part of a broader team of IT professionals at various remote locations (domestic and international). In addition, help provide coverage and support as needed. Ensure documentation is captured appropriately and is easily accessible to the broader IT team. Some heavy lifting required at times (over 25 lbs). Education, Licenses, CertificationsStrong service delivery focus and customer management skills. Experience of supporting and maintaining Windows 10, Windows networking fundamentals, Laptops/Tablets, Excel, Outlook, Office 365 environment (Exchange, OneDrive/SharePoint, Teams etc.)PC hardware and software troubleshooting skills and experience. At least 2 years of experience in an IT Support role. Exposure to ticketing systems, remote access technologies for support, Meraki networks, and RingCentral or similar phone platform. Ability to work independently and to manage competing priorities. Excellent skills/abilities in: organization, planning, multi-tasking, flexibility. High level of professionalism and business acumen. Very good written and verbal communication skills. Ability to actively participate as part of a team. Experience with Azure AD and Intune is a plus. Professional IT work experience in the medical industry is a plus. Microsoft Certifications are a plus. Employment TypeThis is a full-time non-exempt onsite position in our San Francisco clinic that requires early hours and an on-call rotation. In addition, you will need to be flexible to drive to different locations around the Bay Area on an as needed basis.CompensationThe salary range for this role is $30-$35/hr. Want to impact one of the largest industries in the world? Fortera is a materials technology company headquartered in Silicon Valley that has created a new highly engineered zero CO2 cement solution that can reduce CO2 emissions by 100% when combined with green energy sources.The technology is inspired by nature and directly converts CO2 into a replacement for ordinary cement, turning a problem into a product. With over ten years of testing and 100,000 hours of R&D backing the technology, Fortera is ready to grow the team and begin commercial production of this exciting new product. Be on the ground floor of a carbon-to-value movement that will impact millions for generations to come. We are looking for passionate thinkers, doers, and problem-solvers who share our vision that big challenges are big opportunities for change. Visit www.forteraglobal.com for more information.POSITION OVERVIEW:We are seeking a skilled and customer-oriented on-site IT Support Technician to join our small IT team in San Jose, CA. As an IT Support Technician, you will play a vital role in maintaining and enhancing the efficiency of our organization's computing environment. Your primary responsibility will be to provide technical assistance to end-users, troubleshoot hardware and software issues, and ensure that all systems and peripherals are running smoothly. Your expertise in resolving technical problems and delivering exceptional customer service will contribute to the overall productivity and satisfaction of our workforce. This position reports to the Director of IT.RESPONSIBILITIES:Respond to IT support requests from employees, troubleshoot issues, and provide timely resolutions via ticketing system. Provide orientation, training, and technical guidance to employees on hardware and software usage. Provision and manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls. Install, configure, and maintain hardware, software, and networking equipment, including imaging workstations. Track and manage IT assets, including hardware and software inventory. Assist in the implementation and management of IT projects, upgrades, and system integrations. Perform regular system maintenance, backups, and updates to ensure data security and integrity. Monitor the environment in a proactive manner, checking for potential issues and gaps that could cause disruption for our users. Assist in the development and maintenance of IT policies, procedures, and documentation. Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends to recommend improvements and innovations. Support video conferencing software, meetings, and rooms. All other duties as assigned, based on business needs. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's degree in information technology related field of study or equivalent work experience. 1+ years' of relevant experience. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Outstanding organizational and time-management skills. Ability to diagnose and solve problems efficiently and effectively using all available resources. Be detail-oriented, with strong technical and analytical skills. Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal. Maintain a positive attitude, be a team player, and keep end user experience in the forefront. Must be able to learn quickly and be self-driven to learn continuously. General knowledge of network architecture along with internet security principles & best practices. Competency with Windows & Mac OSs, Google Workspace, Active Directory, Microsoft 365, Remote Management & Monitoring tools. Certification as IT Technician will be an advantage (e.g. CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+, Microsoft Certified IT Professional). Familiarity with hybrid cloud environments, virtualization, MFA a plus. Must be able to lift 20+ pounds. COMPENSATION:The hourly range for this job is $31.25 - $36.00, commensurate with experience.Fortera is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by applicable law. Diverse candidates are encouraged to apply.

**THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION**Mark III Construction is currently seeking an Electrical Engineer to oversee Electrical design build and design assist projects. The Electrical Engineer manages the internal and external design efforts. The Electrical Engineer ensures the design intent is being captured, utilizing the most efficient means and systems within the prescribed budget, meeting LEED and Title 24 criteria.Who we are:Mark III Construction is growing, and we want you to grow your career with us! Our benefits, competitive compensation, and dedication to training and growth are what keep our employees happy but our work hard and play hard environment is what keeps everyone excited about coming to work every day.Mark III Construction is a commercial and industrial construction company headquartered in Sacramento, California. Founded in 1976, Mark III started as an electrical contractor with a vision to become a multi-trade construction company. Fast-forward, Mark III‚Äôs footprint extends from Central to Northern California with additional operating offices in Fresno.Mark III takes a big picture approach to the construction process self-performing electrical, plumbing, processed piping, HVAC, low voltage, underground, pre-fabrication, and MEP design. Instead of multiple consultants and countless sub-contractors, the customer works with just one company to eliminate multiple profit layers and complexity of schedules. With an impressive project history in the industrial, commercial, biotechnology, and food-grade technology industries we are able to perform initial construction, tenant improvements, and remodeling. From construction to service, Mark III has the capabilities to support you from the beginning of your project to preventative maintenance for years after. In addition, our dedicated service team is available for 24/7 emergency service and has the capabilities to perform plumbing, electrical, HVAC, general maintenance repairs, and much more.Mission: Leading the Evolution of ConstructionVision: Exposing the World to a New Way to BuildCore Values:TeamworkIntegrityExcellencePerseveranceContinuous ImprovementRequirementsResponsibilities:Manage internal and external electrical design efforts, keep teams on schedule, code compliant, while being mindful of project budgetRepresent the electrical design portion of project meetings as requiredReview outside engineering scopes and contractsManage system and equipment selections, coordinate design requirements with project team, VDC team, and other design partnersBe a resource for estimating with regards to system selections, unit costs, and constructability to assist with budget pricing for pursuits as well as budget updates for projects under contractQualifications:Minimum 5 years of related electrical engineering experience with a Electrical Engineering firm, Electrical contractor, or industry related role required; commercial/industrial experienceComputer proficiency, particularly with the Microsoft Office suiteAbility to multi-task in a high volume, fast-paced work environment with very tight deadlinesStrong verbal and written communication skillsHighly organized, detailed-oriented, and efficientBS in Electrical EngineeringProfessional Engineering Stamp preferredBenefitsHealth Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)Training & DevelopmentOn Site GymSalary Range: $120,00 - 140,000 DOE

Highly motivated and demonstrates personal initiative  Possesses integrity, strong work ethic, positive attitude, and is dependable  Accountable for results.  Adaptable and flexible to the changing needs of projects.  Team player that works well with supervisors, subordinates, peers and clients Company OverviewWood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.com Diversity Statement We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. Job DescriptionTitle: Electrical EngineerPay Rate: $50/hrJob Type: 8-month contractShift(s): Mon - FriLocation: Menlo Park, CA 94025Job Code: JPC-8758/1261650This work location requires proof of full vaccination against the Covid-19 virus, for workers within Department of Medicine/Healthcare*Tekberry is looking for a highly qualified and motivated individual to work with our client, a world-class university and research center. As a W2 employee you will have access to health benefits. Benefits include health, dental, and vision (eligible on the 1st of the month following your start date).Job Description:The Office for the Dean of Research seeks an Electrical Engineer to participate in new and ongoing projects at the University Synchrotron Radiation Lightsource (SSRL). You will have technical responsibility for a range of duties including design, development, fabrication, integration, testing and fielding of both analog and digital electrical systems. You will function as an individual contributor with general guidance as a member of a project team. This position is in the Structural Molecular Biology (SMB) group at SSRL and supports x-ray beam line stations dedicated to macromolecular crystallography research and allied efforts including the development of advanced instrumentation to meet cutting-edge experimental goals including fully remote access and time-resolved measurements.This position places an emphasis on working closely with a multi-disciplinary team to develop complex hardware designs. The successful candidate will have an eagerness to learn and desire to work as a member of a larger team. You are expected to demonstrate electrical engineering knowledge, be able to independently resolve approaches to technical problems, and have communication capabilities adequate to communicate broadly across our team's membership. Some examples: you will develop, produce, and test simple to complex printed circuit boards for various tasks; develop and implement end-to-end designs built around industrial controllers for various motion control tasks; and program FPGAs for various operations.Your responsibilities will include:Development of motion control systems and specialized experimental instrumentation, collaboratively with a group of scientists and technical staff. Lead projects from initial concept through design review sessions, culminating with directing electronics and mechanical technicians in the fabrication and installation of novel devices. Troubleshoot motion control equipment, data acquisition electronics, specialized synchrotron radiation instrumentation, and other devices. Research equipment and suppliers and oversee the acquisition of new hardware for motion controls and data acquisition systems. Schedule fabrication and coordinate activities to ensure project deadlines are met on time. Create documentation and organization of drawings, parts lists, and assembly instructions. Contribute as a member of a fast-paced team in an advanced R&D environment. Requirements:BS in electrical engineering and 3-5 years of applicable experience in a research and development or manufacturing environment is required. Demonstrated project management skills are required. Knowledge of analog/digital circuit design and troubleshooting is required. Demonstrated ability to implement industrial motion control systems is required, and in particular experience in the use of Galil digital motion controllers is highly advantageous. Experience in the design of electrical conditioning-circuits is required, such as for optical switches, transducers including LVDT's, incremental and absolute encoders, X-ray ionization chambers, and PIN diode detectors. Knowledge of embedded systems development and FPGA programming with VHDL is required and schematic capture experience is highly advantageous. The candidate must be proficient using Windows and UNIX computer environments including Microsoft Word, Outlook, and Excel applications. Good communication skills, including the ability to interact productively with a diverse group of scientific users, administrative and technical coworkers is required. Bonus/Preferred Qualifications include:Experience leading a team in the development, assembly and maintenance of control systems or new instrumentation is highly advantageous. Skill in application programming in C++ and TCL/TK and LabVIEW is a plus. Experience with CAD or Solid Edge mechanical design software, mechanical fabrication practices, reliability testing, and quality control processes is desirable. Operating knowledge of Dectris Pixel Array Detector (PAD) technology is highly desirable. Knowledge of Synchrotron Science, Structural Biology or X-ray Crystallography methods is not required but an advantage. Experience developing web based documentation and applications is a plus. TEKBERRY OFFERS A $100 payment FOR REFERRALS!Tekberry, Inc. a Soal Technologies company, is an equal opportunity employer. US citizens, Green Card Holders and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to work Corp to Corp or to sponsor H-1B visas currently. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.Tekberry, Inc is a Certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) and Certified Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE).By submitting your resume, you are explicitly consenting to receive communications from our organization via text message. Rest assured all our texts are sent by real people and we look forward to a conversation with you about this job! Schneider Engineering is seeking an Electrical Engineer to join our System Planning team.The successful candidate will contribute to a multi-disciplinary team within the division to complete System Planning projects. This position will be located in our Boerne, Texas office and may require some overnight travel to project sites.Job ResponsibilitiesThe principal duties and responsibilities of the Project Engineer consists of, but are not limited to, the following:Complete Electric System Planning studies, Construction Work Plans and Long-Range Plans based on transmission, substation, and distribution system analysis. Assist in scheduling and budgeting requirements for planning projects. Represent Schneider and Client when meeting with other stakeholders including property owners, other engineering firms or construction services. Effectively communicate with Client(s) in a timely manner for assigned projects, representing Schneider. Keeps informed on new developments within the industry, requirements affecting the business due to new developments and proposes recommended changes to Management for business continuity. Maintain good project documentation, including calculations, telephone conversations, planning decisions, rationale and filing copies of all pertinent information. Develop and maintain positive professional relationships with key Client personnel with whom project work is interfaced with. EducationBachelor‚Äôs Degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited program; Possess strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills and able to communicate effectively, orally and in writing. SkillsStrong (effective) written and verbal communication skills, exceptional computer skills, with emphasis in engineering software, project management, Microsoft Word and Excel applications. Strong skills of time management, organizational and multi-tasking. AutoCAD experience preferred. Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours.Lockheed Martin Aeronautics is seeking a full-time Early Career Manufacturing Engineer. Manufacturing Engineers provide support for all stages of a platform‚Äôs program lifecycle. The Manufacturing Engineering (ME) discipline is consulted and responsible for manufacturing plan development, full-rate production standup and support, and post-delivery sustainment and modification activities. MEs are integral at every program stage for efficient and effective aircraft production.This position will be embedded in detailed manufacturing plans, concepts, processes, and procedures. The day-to-day tasking will include working with shop floor personnel, design engineering, quality engineering, industrial engineering, and other engineering disciplines to support production of our various platforms.A Successful Candidate Can Expect To Thrive in a fast-paced environment Enjoy working in a production environment with operators Be self-motivated, take initiative, and have strong work ethic Have a learning and continuous improvement attitudeThis position requires a detail-oriented and organized candidate with demonstrated technical proficiency and capability. Strong communication skills ‚Äì written and verbal ‚Äì are required to successfully interface with various departments within Aero.Must be a US Citizen. This position will require a government security clearance. This position is at a facility that requires special access.Basic Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technology-related degree plan: Manufacturing Engineering, Manufacturing Systems Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering Technology, Manufacturing & Mechanical Engineering Technology, Product Design and Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering Technology, or Aeronautics Engineering Technology Other degrees within consideration include: Product Engineering and Assembly, Manufacturing Quality and Productivity, Manufacturing System Design, Process and Product Engineering, Materials and Manufacturing Processes, Manufacturing Process and Tool Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aero Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering Desire to be in an Operations role indicated by expressing interest in ‚Äòhands-on‚Äô applications of engineering and manufacturing principles Must be a US Citizen. This position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special accessDesired Skills Previous manufacturing/operations experience Member of the SME, SAE, ASME, or other similar technical organization Design, build club/project experience (i.e., SAE Formula and Baja) Ability to work in a collaborative and team-based environmentSecurity Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.Clearance Level: SecretOther Important Information You Should KnowExpression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per weekLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. We place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering an inclusive environment built upon integrity and corporate responsibility.If this sounds like a culture you connect with, you‚Äôre invited to apply for this role. Or, if you are unsure whether your experience aligns with the requirements of this position, we encourage you to search on Lockheed Martin Jobs, and apply for roles that align with your qualifications.Experience Level: 4 yr and up CollegeBusiness Unit: AERONAUTICS COMPANYRelocation Available: YesCareer Area: ManufacturingType: Full-TimeShift: First

Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer Early Career - Ocala, FL
Job Description:
Description:Ocala Operations is a manufacturing facility occupying over 340,000 square feet, building circuit cards, wiring harnesses, and electronic assemblies for missiles and fire control.At Lockheed Martin, we apply our passion for purposeful innovation to keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. We are seeking talented Manufacturing or Industrial engineers to join our team to help develop many best-in-class products and solutions in our Missiles & Fire Control in Ocala, FL. Click https://www.lockheedmartin.com/en-us/who-we-are/business-areas/missiles-and-fire-control.html to learn more about MFC.Job Duties Include Candidate should be able to develop and implement Manufacturing Process Plans (MPPs) for a variety of electronic and electro-mechanical assemblies. Utilize basic drafting and software programs to develop MPPs, design tooling, support equipment, and process flows. Provide technical guidance and support to manufacturing operators to facilitate assembly performance. Apply lean manufacturing techniques to reduce cost and increase yields. Must have good communication skills and be able to work effectively in a team environment. Investigate the root cause of failures/defects and implement corrective action to support continuous improvement.What‚Äôs In It For YouBenefitsOur employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy: Medical Dental 401k Paid time off Work/life balance Career development Mentorship opportunities Rewards & recognitionLearn more about Lockheed Martin‚Äôs comprehensive benefits package here.Basic QualificationsBachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or related discipline from an accredited college.This position will be located at a facility that requires special access and requires the selected candidate to be a US Citizen.Desired SkillsKnowledge in Lean manufacturing concepts and techniques.Basic skills in 3D modeling software such as Solidworks and 3D Printing prototyping.Understanding the concept of Root Cause/Corrective Action.Data analytics.Familiar with Lean Six Sigma.Clearance Level: NoneOther Important Information You Should KnowExpression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per weekLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. This mechanical engineering position is for design, analysis, documentation, test and fleet support associated with Antisubmarine Warfare programs with Lockheed Martin.Areas Of Responsibilities Will Typically Include Supporting the Mechanical and HW lead on Project planning, cost and schedule estimating, Program meetings with customer, scope creep management and weekly priorities. Supporting system level solid modeling, assembly level solid modeling, bill-of-material management. Experience with solid modeling CAD tools will be required Creo (ProEngineer) and EPDM (Parts Lists) a plus. Supporting Conceptual, Preliminary and Detailed component solid modeling and design, including assembly and piece part manufacturing drawings, parts lists, cable harness design, and engineering change support. This includes program planning from a cost, technical and schedule perspective, structural and thermal analysis, trade studies, cost analysis, drawing generation and documentation release, and environmental qualification testing. Interfacing with other disciplines, such as Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Production Control, and Quality will be key to ensuring customer requirements are being met. Mentoring entry level engineers on a daily basis to ensure all work is within scope and on plan and in accordance with program shuffling priorities. Experience performing Structural and/or Thermal Analysis and being able to present results to the Mechanical Lead and the HW Lead. Experience with Environmental Qualification Planning, Procedures, Test Support, and Test Reports.

Job Title: Entry Level Mechanical/Manufacturing Engineer (Open to recent grads/USC/GC/GC-EAD)-MW
Job Description:
Location: Waterloo, Iowa, 50704 (Onsite)Pay rate: $35/hr - $37/hrShift Hours: This opening will mainly be 3rd shift (10:30 pm to 7:00 am) but candidates must be open to both 3rd and 1st shift. Overtime is likely, weekend and before shift starts.This position is eligible for incremental, progressive retention bonuses at every 90 days for the first year on assignment. Job DescriptionLooking for a responsible & passionate mechanical design engineer to help us design and build complex mechanical systems for various local silicon-valley companies. The candidate must have a good understanding of physics/engineering principles, and a good intuition for mechanical design. Familiar with design components, manufacturing processes, materials, and finishes. Fluent in 3D CAD / Solidworks, drawings, creating BOMs. We are looking for a skilled mechanic engineer that can work with the co-founders to take sketches & concepts in early stages and develop them into full working prototypes.Applied Precision Design is a small engineering design company, with an excellent reputation in Silicon Valley. Our clients are often brilliant research scientists who need help in building incredibly challenging hardware, often in various industries such as semiconductor, optics, metrology, machine design, and general research. We are growing and would like to welcome a capable mechanical engineer that can take a sketch and develop it into a full design/prototype. As a small company, we have a kind, fun, and flexible work environment - and we take pride in producing high quality work.The candidate would take direction from Sr. Level engineers and will help them develop concepts from early stages to prototypes and final products. Will be involved in engineering meetings to collect requirements. Will be responsible for generating quick layouts & preliminary concepts in Solidworks. Hold periodic and formal design reviews. Take ownership of the project and drive it forward. Develop sound engineering concepts with requirements in mind. Detail design, calculations, drawings, and hands-on assembly of the prototypes. Ideally familiar with cleanrooms, vacuum systems, industrial components, precision machine design and opto-mechanical design.Qualifications:Passionate ‚Äì enjoys creating / building / designing mechanical systems. Experienced ‚Äì has designed/built precision mechanical systems (entire development cycle)Familiar with Machine Design: Fluent in 3D CAD / Solidworks, Concept/Detail design, collecting requirement, good presentations/design reviews, drawings, drafting standards, etc. Careful engineering, organized, systematic, and very detail oriented. Familiar with machining / manufacturing processes, materials, anodize/finishes, cleaning procedures, etc. Experience with hands-on building. Hard-working, Responsible ‚Äì (skin in the game) Dedicated to finishing project. Passionate about learning new things and taking direction from other engineers. Able to read and produce engineering sketches (to convey complex designs concepts). Good communication skills. Able to generate concepts in Solidworks quickly. Familiar with basics of mechanical engineering ‚Äì basic ME design calculations, structural calculations, basic knowledge of heat transfer, dynamics, vibrations, etc. B.S. or M.S. Mechanical Engineering with relevant experienceIndustry: machine design, precision / opto-mechanical design, semiconductor, optics, vacuum.

JOB PURPOSE:At H3X, we are building the most advanced electric propulsion systems in the world to enable sustainable electric aircraft. At 12 kW/kg continuous, the HPDM family of integrated motor drives is a step change in electric propulsion technology and removes one of the main barriers blocking widespread proliferation of electric aircraft. We have several power classes of motors ranging from 30kW to 3MW and are selling to several markets including aviation, aerospace and defense, marine, and specialized ground vehicles.H3X is looking to hire mechanical engineering interns for Spring or Summer 2024 to support the prototype development across all aspects of our integrated motor drives. This is not an ordinary internship. You will be given the full responsibility of a mechanical engineer. The engineering team is intentionally small and operates at a very fast pace. A high degree of self-motivation and responsibility is required as you will be given significant freedom and will be directly responsible for your parts.RESPONSBILITIES:REQUIREMENTS / CONCEPTIdentify root cause of failuresEstablish requirements for given sub-systemsDESIGN AND ANALYSISDesign parts & assemblies utilizing SolidWorksConduct PDRs & CDRs for responsible sub-systemsPROTOTYPE AND MANUFACTURINGCompile & source Bill of Materials for responsible sub-systemsGenerate engineering drawings via SolidWorksPerform tolerance stack-ups and convey via GD&T in engineering drawingsCreate build instructions for responsible sub-systemsTESTING AND VALIDATIONCreate Design Validation Plan and Report (DVP&R) for sub-systemsExecute testing and characterization of responsible sub-system Post process test results, identify root-cause of potential new issues and make design recommendations to meet the highest level of reliability and performance INTEGRATIONIntegrate sub-system into full systemSupport future production builds or complete system testsOTHERIdentify workplace hazards and implement safe processesMaintain testing and production equipment where necessaryREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Graduate Degree in Mechanical Engineering or similarGPA of 3.0 or higherHands-on experience assembling mechanical systemsSolidWorks proficient (or similar)Excellent written and verbal communicationExceptional understanding of fundamentalsAction biased, results-driven mentalityWillingness to learn quicklyPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Experience with manufacturing processes (machining, Metal AM, & composites) Experience with producing 2D part drawings & GD&TExperience with linear structural FEAAVAILABLE INTERNSHIPS:Spring semester 2024Summer 2024Compensation$22-$32/hrBENEFITS:Health insurance: medical, vision, dentalGym membership stipendFlexible hours (deliverable-based goals)Flexible-time off (just need manager approval)Relocation package to the beautiful Denver, Colorado areaCompany laptopWeekly company happy hoursTHE COMPANY:H3X Technologies is a U.S.-based manufacturer of high power density integrated motor drives for electric aircraft and other high-performance applications. We are a team of multidisciplinary engineers and operators brought together with the singular purpose of developing the most advanced electric aircraft propulsion systems in the world to enable sustainable aviation on a massive scale. Our world-class team is composed of the best and brightest from Tesla, SpaceX, GE Aviation, and Siemens with deep knowledge in aerospace, electric machines, power electronics, material science, control systems, and advanced manufacturing. The high performance of our core technology is made possible by our own proprietary manufacturing processes for motor stacking, winding, and assembly, and all of the design and testing for our products is done in-house. Our headquarters facility is in Lakewood, Colorado and in 2023, we will unveil a new production facility that will also be located in the greater Denver area. Our vision is to become the world‚Äôs leading supplier of aviation-grade electric propulsion systems by 2030.We are well-funded and have backing from top VC firms around the world including Y Combinator, Metaplanet, TechNexus, Liquid 2 Ventures, and Soma Capital to deploy capital for rapid scaleup.H3X is an equal opportunity-affirmative action employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, past or present military service or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate

Join the exciting Components Engineering team, which is part of our Materials Specialty and Process Engineering department, as a Components Engineer. The team is a cornerstone to our design, production, and sustainment programs.You will be responsible for providing Components Engineering support as a technical expert for mechanical standard parts as well as providing standard part support (fasteners, bearings, fluid fittings, etc‚Ä¶) to Lockheed Martin Aeronautics programs. You will get the opportunity to work on several aircraft programs, including Skunkworks programs, as well as work in a very dynamic work environment with a lot of opportunity for growth.What You Will Be DoingResponsibilitiesYou will perform a core role providing expertise and management of standard parts in support of wire harness design and production. You will control standard part configuration through the preparation and release of program standard part drawings and revision level control of vendor standard part drawings specific to mechanical aircraft equipment. Your responsibilities will include: Supporting conceptual and layout design phases with standard parts expertise. Promoting product quality through qualification of suppliers, maintenance of authorized supplier list, and coordination with quality department on standard part quality issues. Mitigating part procurement schedule impacts through vendor coordination, technical inputs, alternate suppliers, action request resolution, and substitution documentation. Supporting production through investigation and resolution of standard part related issues impacting manufacturing. Maintain awareness of the technical and business state-of-affairs for standard part industries. Maintaining standard parts tool for quick identification and selection of standard parts and ensure standardization across Lockheed Martin and suppliers.Who You AreYou have a background in engineering requirements and selection of mechanical standard parts. You are a multi-faceted teammate able to communicate and function effectively on a dynamic multisite team, must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills.

The Role, At a GlanceBiamp is seeking an enthusiastic, skilled Mechanical Engineer to work within a cross-disciplinary team responsible for the design of professional audio and video products from concept to production. This position is a terrific opportunity to take your career to the next level in a dynamic company. Here, you will see the products you design successfully launched into the global marketplace.How You'll ContributeCreate innovative new product design solutions that help drive Biamp revenue and profitability. As the Mechanical Engineering core team lead, design complex mechanical systems for AV products in a stage-and-gate, New Product Development/Introduction process from concept through production launch. Start with a PRD (Product Requirements Document) and understand customer needs, work with team members, including product management, project management, and multiple cross-functional engineering disciplines (e.g., electrical engineering, firmware, DSP, software, test, manufacturing, quality, compliance), to establish comprehensive technical specifications. Create detailed 3D solid design models of parts, assemblies, and drawings using SolidWorks maintained in a PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) database. Conduct thermal and structural analysis including the use of test equipment and software modeling tools (CFD, FEA, etc.). Build and test prototype devices to meet thermal, structural, industrial design, and regulatory/compliance (REACH/RoHS, CE, UL) requirements. Apply critical thinking skills to identify root cause of defects and direct corrective action solutions to resolve issues in a timely fashion both during NPD and sustaining engineering for Operations. Self-directed progress on tasks, strategic thinking, enable of positive team culture, and champion engineering process improvement projects to make Biamp more competitive and maintain our company‚Äôs leadership position. Serve as a technical resource, provide guidance and unblock other team members, and early career engineers. Other duties as assigned. A Successful Candidate Should HaveBS in Mechanical Engineering‚ÄØor the equivalent combination of education and experience. MS Mechanical Engineering a bonus. 3 to 5 years of CAD experience as a Mechanical Engineer using SolidWorks (Agile PLM experience preferred). Experience designing assemblies for loudspeakers, microphones, amplifiers, sound bars, video systems, and network server products preferred. Knowledge of machine shop, wood working, sheet metal, metal finishing, and plastic injection molding practices. Solid understanding of material properties including plastic, metal, and wood. Ability to engage in NPD/I multiple projects simultaneously. Solid written and oral communication skills in English. Strong attention to detail. Work EnvironmentThis is an onsite position based in Chester, PA.Manufacturing and office environment.Routine use of standard office equipment.Prolonged sitting or standing.Limited travel expected (less than 5%).What We OfferMedical, Dental, and Vision 3 weeks annual PTO and 9 paid holidays 401(k) + matching Employer-paid base life insurance, short, and long-term disability Health savings accounts (with Biamp contribution) and flexible spending accounts Tuition reimbursement Discretionary profit-sharing Referral bonuses Charitable donation matchingWho is Biamp?We make the world‚Äôs most extraordinary audio and video solutions. For over 40 years, Biamp has created and innovated professional audiovisual solutions that enable great communication. From the smallest of rooms to the largest of venues, we empower true human connection in every space.As We Grow To Meet Our Customers‚Äô Needs And Evolve To Address The Challenges Of Tomorrow, One Guiding Principle Remains The SameBiamp connects people through extraordinary audiovisual experiences.About Our CompanyAt Biamp, we believe the employment relationship should be reciprocal. We want you to love your job, and we want your expertise and knowledge to help drive our business forward. We champion a supportive and dynamic environment filled with passionate people who choose continuous improvement over perfection. We insist on clear, explicit decision making, believe in taking calculated risks, and celebrate tough decisions even when they don‚Äôt succeed. We look for people who desire the best from themselves and encourage the same from their coworkers. Our commitment to one another and to the common goal is the most consistent reliable path to recurring success for all of us.Biamp is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Motivo is looking to bring new Mechanical Engineering talent onto our project teams and contribute to the development of new, world-changing technologies.Who are we?We are a team of engineers, fabricators, e-techs, and technologists taking on the most ambitious and impactful projects we can get our hands on. We explicitly target hardware challenges and have enabled audacious visionaries in a number of industry verticals to achieve market viability and prominence. Our clients often credit us with their early success and we are honored to partner with some of the biggest players in EV, robotics, and aerospace R&D.What‚Äôs it like?An engineering role at Motivo means broad ownership and education. There are no cogs here. You‚Äôll be responsible for ideation and feature definition, system-level design, client and vendor management, and hardware bring-ups. You‚Äôll be the owner of your designs. You‚Äôll have a seat at the table with CEOs/CTOs and have a voice to contribute to product strategy and viability. We are a premium engineering consultancy and our clients‚Äô success depends on you actually voicing up and shaping the big pictureRequirementsSuccess at Motivo is largely driven by hard-work, creativity, and collaboration. But some baseline experience we‚Äôre looking for involves mechanism design (planning, modeling, verification), hands-on skills (prototyping, fabrication, testing), and analysis (static, dynamic, thermal). Everyone has a mix of experience, which we value, but we tend to look closely for people that get excited to learn new things and expand their skillset.Show us what you‚Äôve got and let‚Äôs talk!We‚Äôre hoping these keywords might help us find you:CAD, mechanical analysis, hydraulics, chassis design, kinematics, injection molding, additive manufacturing, simulation, electrical/electronic/control systems, prototyping, machine vision, sensors/perception, motor/motion control, robots/robotics/automation, controls, SAEBenefitsWe‚Äôre convinced that the team and projects are hands down the best part of working at Motivo, but we also have some pretty sweet benefits including company-wide profit sharing, high-quality insurance plans, 401k match, generous paid vacation time, an onsite massage therapist, a Monday-Thursday 4/10 work week and more!Base Salary Range: $70,000 - $100,000Annual Profit Sharing estimate: $14,000 - $20,000Salary is dependent on experience, knowledge, and interview performance.

Opening 2024The Administrator is responsible for the overall leadership and operation of the facility‚Äôs services, departments, budget and functions, subject to oversight by the Board of Directors. The Administrator directs the ongoing mission and philosophy of care of the facility by demonstrating leadership through exploring, developing, accepting and implementing new ideas with vision, foresight, and customer sensitivity to meet the facility‚Äôs and community‚Äôs needs. The Administrator shall assure the facility is adequately staffed, programming standards are met and adequate resources are provided to meet the needs of the patient populations served. The Administrator is responsible for the facility‚Äôs financial performance, overseeing departmental and committee activity, coordinating efforts to established facility/committee goals, strategic planning, performance improvement planning, marketing and community liaison activities in adherence with the facility policy and procedures, compliance plan, and all internal and external regulatory bodies that apply to the daily operation of the facility. All duties to be done in accordance with Joint Commission, Federal and State regulations, Oceans Behavioral Mission, policies and procedures and Performance Improvement Standards.Essential Functions:Managing the overall operation of the Hospital, with responsibility to the Governing Board, including control, utilization, and conservation of its physical and financial assets. Review and advise in the preparation of annual budget showing the hospital's expected receipts and expenditures; responsible for the supervision of all business affairs and to ensure that all expenditures are controlled to the best possible advantage. Managing the ongoing functions of the Hospital by recruiting, employing, and directing adequate numbers of appropriate trained professional and auxiliary personnel, including delegating duties appropriately;Submits monthly reports showing the professional service and financial activities of the hospital and prepares and submits such special reports as may be required by the Governing Body. Assisting the Governing Body in formulating policy by preparing and presenting to and reviewing with the Governing Body (i) long-term and short-term plans of the Hospital, (ii) reports on the nature and extent of funding and other available resources, (iii) reports describing the Hospital's operations, (iv) reports evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of the Hospital or its program activity, and (v) budgets and financial statements. To attend, or have his designated representative attend, all meetings of the Medical Staff; name hospital departmental representatives to Medical Staff committees, when appropriate, and when requested by the Medical Staff. Cooperates with the Medical Staff and to secure like cooperation on the part of all those concerned with the rendering of professional service to the end that the best possible care may be rendered to all patients. Complies with Federal and State statutes and regulations in the performance of his/her duties; Assures that appropriate policies, plans and goals are effectively communicated to all staff members. Determine which care, treatment or services are provided directly and which are provided through consultation, contract or other agreement. Assures that leadership assesses patient flow issues within the hospital, the impact on patient safety and mitigation of that impact. Performs other related duties as assigned. RequirementsA minimum of a Master‚Äôs Degree, with the undergraduate or graduate degree in a Behavioral Services, Administration or a related health care field. Must possess one of the following: (1) Master's Degree and at least three years of full time experience in progressively responsible management positions in healthcare or (2) a Baccalaureate Degree and at least five years of full time experience in progressively responsible management positions in healthcare or (3) at least ten years of full time experience in hospital administration.The Administrator must be a sound leader who possesses excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster cooperation across departmental lines and manage information, environmental and fiscal resources to accomplish goals. The Administrator must be able to maintain and demonstrate a broad knowledge of tasks and assets necessary to accomplish the company objectives. Must have knowledge about needs and requirements of third party payers and the ability to be culturally sensitive to diverse groupings of employees and consumers of services as well as maintain knowledge. Must be continually be up-to-date on State, Federal regulations; The Joint Commission regulations, etc. Must successfully complete CPR certification and an Oceans approved behavioral health de-escalation program.Subject to many interruptions. Occasional pressure due to multiple calls and inquiries. This position can be high paced and stressful; must be able to cope mentally and physically to atmosphere. This person might sometimes experience disagreeable odors, sights and/or unpredictable patient behavior. Work requires spending approximately 90% or more of the time inside a building that offers protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. May be required to travel.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, COVID-19 vaccines are required for all employees, as well as all newly hired employees. We require documentation upon hire.SummaryHealth Center Administrator (HCA) will be responsible for providing operational leadership for the Patient Care Supervisors (PCS) and Patient Experience Supervisors (PES) at the designated health center(s). The HCA will serve as a resource and assist in monitoring the quality of the clinical standards of care as it relates to infection control, medication management and medication safety. This includes ongoing monitoring of clinic workflows and quality logs for integrity and accuracy as well as collecting, analyzing and reporting data for the agency as it relates to the areas of medication management, infection control and other initiatives related to health quality.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesConduct ongoing surveillance and data reporting through regular site audits to ensure compliance for medication management and safety and infection control to align with standards related to the Joint Commission, OSHA, Public Health Department and Center for Disease Control.Facilitate clinical trainings for new hire onboarding, quarterly trainings, and remedial trainings based on identified need. Collaborate with PCS and PES to facilitate staff development that includes goal setting for performance improvement.Provide supervision and feedback that maximizes employee potential, promotes positive problem solving and improvement of systems.Utilize quality improvement practices and data driven problem-solving methods to improve, develop and maintain health center systems and procedures.Ensure patient/customer satisfaction by analyzing and reporting patient/customer satisfaction input through focus groups, surveys, individual contacts and patient complaints, concerns and suggestions, utilizing the PDSA model for problem-solving.Coordinate with PES and PCS to ensure appropriate and adequate amount of supplies are maintained for patient care.Collaborate with Quality and Safety in development and implementation of medication management and infection control trainings for improving compliance. Collaborate with Infection Control to ensure compliance for mandated IDPH reporting. Collaborate with Infection Control to develop and implement protocols for improving Infection Control compliance.Oversee specialty clinics for COVID Vaccines and Behavioral Health Injections.Perform all other duties as assigned.Essential Functions And Key CompetenciesExcellent organizational skills and attention to detail, deadlines and program compliance.Excellent oral and written skills.Ability to anticipate next steps and take initiative.Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team to meet health division goals and priorities.Ability to manage multiple and competing demands and establish priorities.Ability to learn quickly and adapt to change in processes and organization.Willingness to act as a strong team player and bring an optimistic level of energy to the team.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCEAssociates or LPN/RN degree preferred or 3 -5 years of supervisory experience, preferably in a hospital or clinic setting, required. Working knowledge of Excel/Word/OutlookOther QualificationsCurrent driver‚Äôs licenseCurrent auto insuranceAunt Martha‚Äôs is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
