We require documentation upon hire.SummaryThe RN Health Center Administrator is responsible for providing clinical and operational leadership for assigned regional ambulatory health centers to ensure optimal patient care in the most cost-effective manner. The Administrator supervises all positions in the health center that deliver primary care services and interacts with other departments to meet organizational needs. The Administrator ensures adherence of staff to all policies and procedures and acts as a resource for clinical as well as administrative functions. Directly responsible for delivery of quality of care through competency assessment and training under the direction of the Clinical Operations Director or other designated leadership.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Oversees all clinical services at designated health centers to ensure a positive patient experience from registration through check-out. Actively conducts, assigns and participates in daily huddles. Oversees clinical orientation and ongoing evaluation of MA skills and competencies. Collaborates with central scheduling to review weekly assignments to ensure staffing ratios are appropriate. Reviews clinic performance and evaluates results from quality reports, utilizing corrective action to meet or exceed performance standards. Provides coaching and mentoring for identified training needs for clinical staff (MA/MOA). Monitors productivity daily to ensure patient and provider benchmarks are achieved. Audits abnormal results daily and conducts periodic chart audits to ensure compliance for follow-up according to Aunt Martha‚Äôs protocol. Addresses patient, provider and staff complaints immediately or within 24 hours either directly or through established appropriate Aunt Martha‚Äôs channels. Regularly reviews audit and quality improvement activities and makes recommendations for improvements. Provides direct patient care as needed. Participates in the roll out of new services and procedures through use of huddles, demonstration, and follow up. Demonstrates professional and ethical behavior at all times per Aunt Martha‚Äôs rules, policies, and procedures. Conducts monthly staff meetings with assigned health centers for planning and review of agency policy and procedures, program requirements, and operational activities related to meeting quality benchmarks, patient satisfaction, productivity and optimal performance of all positions. Ensures the completion of assigned clinical duties (administrative/phone messages, patient cases, and tasks, including, but not limited to labs, medications, standing orders, waived). Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Supervisory Key Competencies Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; enforcing policy compliance; addressing complaints Appropriate medical record documentation, CPT, coding and selection of correct department as part of the clinical revenue cycle. Advanced concepts, practices, and procedures of nursing and operational ambulatory care practices, and quality control techniques. HIPAA regulations and compliance requirements. Blood borne pathogens and safe handling techniques. Knowledge of OSHA, CDC, and Joint Commission guidelinesEDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCE Current RN license in State of Illinois. Associate Degree, Bachelor Degree preferred. Minimum 5 years nursing experience in an ambulatory care setting with at least 2 years in a supervisory role or any equivalent combination of experience.Certificates, Licenses, RegistrationsCurrent RN license in good standing in the State of Illinois; CPR certification.Other QualificationsDocumentation of experience applying the nursing process including, assessment, planning and interventionCurrent driver‚Äôs license Current auto insuranceAbility to work late evening hours Ability to work some weekend hours Ability to work some holidaysAbility to travel to and work at other clinics as neededAunt Martha‚Äôs is an equal opportunity employer. Job DescriptionJOB SUMMARY: The overall responsibility of this position is to oversee the daily operations. The Administrator will coach, supervise, train, and mentor employees to ensure that the practice operates in a safe and efficient manner. Additionally, it will ensure that patients receive the highest quality of care and customer service.QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION:Bachelor‚Äôs Degree (B.A) or equivalent, two to four years related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Computer knowledge: MS Word, MS Excel, and Outlook. Bi-lingual English/SpanishACA Certification ABILITIES/SKILLS:Strong organization, problem-solving, and analytical skills; able to manage priorities and workflows to lead a team. Acute attention to detail. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong leadership skills; must be able to work independently with minimal supervision. Ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals across the organization. Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions. Demonstrate ability to plan and organize projects. Able to respect and maintain patient confidentiality at all times. Must be dependable and conduct him/herself in a professional manner. Must be able to follow policies and procedures. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Directly supervises all the employees within the practice. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization‚Äôs policies and applicable laws. Ensures compliance with licensing, state, and federal regulations. Supervises and oversees the patient flow. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, training, counseling, and evaluating employees; planning, assigning, and directing work. ESSENTIAL DUTIES/ RESPONSIBILITIES: Manages and organizes office operations and procedures, including but not limited to bookkeeping, payroll, information management, filing systems, supplies, and staffing. Orders and maintains office supplies and inventory. Analyzes and maximizes office productivity and monitors unnecessary employee overtime. Establishes, modifies, implements, and monitors systems and procedures to enhance timely and efficient workflow. Develops and monitors office budget; ensures office activities are conducted within budgetary restrictions; initiates cost reduction programs. Must monitor that employees are accurately registering patients with the correct demographic information, member identification, and insurance plan. Ensure that patients‚Äô insurance is verified prior to the office visit or procedure and that referrals/authorizations are being obtained as required by the patient's health plan in order to avoid denied claims. Responsible for the volume of patients seen daily and the volume of procedures scheduled. Prepares reports and correspondence as needed. Manages office copays, petty cash funds, and reimbursement procedures. Assists with general clerical/administrative duties as needed, including but not limited to answering phones, filing, preparing correspondence and memoranda, faxing, copying, and mailing. Interviews, trains, supervises, motivates, and develops office staff; manages schedules and workflow. Assigns duties and monitors the quality of work; assures staff conforms to organizational policies and procedures and government regulations. Complies with Infection Control and OSHA Regulations (biomedical waste, handling, and disposal) for the practice as per regulations,Provides day-to-day guidance and oversight of subordinates; actively works to promote and recognize performance. Keeps up to date on the overall activities of the team, identifying problem areas and taking corrective actions. Performs other duties as assigned by management. We offer competitive salary and Benefits (Health Insurance, Dental, Vision,401K)

RN Sub-Acute Role‚ÄúI have learned more here at Avocado Post Acute in the almost 2 years I have been here, than I have in the rest of my entire nursing career.‚Äù - RN July 2023Job Description:The Registered Nurse (RN) supervises and coordinates the efforts of nursing staff and provides total nursing care for residents. In addition to the essential functions outlined herein, this position is considered to be a direct resident care role specific to our Sub-Acute Unit.Requirements:Assist the Station Manager, RN Nurse Supervisor in determining the staffing needs of the nursing service department.Ensure that a sufficient number of certified nursing assistants are available for each tour of duty to ensure that routine nursing care is provided to meet the daily nursing care needs of each resident.Develop work assignments and schedule duty hours, and/or assist nursing supervisory staff in completing and performing such tasks.Make daily rounds of your assigned station to ensure that all certified nursing assistants are performing their work assignments in accordance with acceptable nursing standards.Monitor absenteeism to ensure that an adequate number of nursing care personnel are on duty at all times. Report problem areas to the Station Manager, RN Nurse Supervisor.Review complaints and grievances made or filed by department personnel. Make appropriate reports to the Nurse Supervisor as required or as may be necessary.Create and maintain an atmosphere of warmth, personal interest and positive emphasis as well as a calm environment throughout your station and shift.Meet with your CNAs on a regularly scheduled basis to assist in identifying and correcting problem areas and or to assist in the improvement of services.Review and evaluate your CNAs.Report occupational exposures to blood, body fluid, infectious materials and hazardous chemicals in accordance with the facilities policies and procedures governing accidents and incidents.Avocado Post Acute is a unique healthcare facility that specializes in post-acute rehab. Throughout the years, we‚Äôve continuously committed to providing a higher level of nursing care by personalizing our services to our patients‚Äô needs. Avocado Post Acute is proud to offer a fun, exciting program including outings, high-tech gaming, and various events and classes to cater to our residents‚Äô psychosocial needs.

Job Title: Travel Nurse RN - ICU - $2,152.00 per week
Job Description:
Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Nurses treat acutely ill patients with life-threatening conditions, in settings requiring continuous vigilance and high-intensity therapies. ICU nurses can specialize in a variety of disciplines including medical, surgical, cardiac, burn or Neuro ICU.Requirements Active BLS and ACLS from the American Heart Association  Active professional license within the state of practice  Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS), NIHSS (stroke care certification) and Critical Care Registered Nurse (CCRN) credentials are recommended and may be required for specific travel nurse positions  Other specialty-related certifications are preferred and may be required for specific travel nurse positions  Critical Care experience in a hospital setting  Minimum of 2 years of experience as an RN  Travel Nursing Job Details Weekly Pay: $2,152.00 per weekLocation: Newport News,VA Shift Schedule: Nights  Assignment Duration: 13 Weeks  Weekly Hours: 36 Hours BenefitsDay 1 Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision), Flexible Housing Options, Guaranteed Stipend: Facility Cancelled Shifts, PTO Program, Weekly Pay, Paid Compliance Cost, Referral Bonuses, Extra Shift Bonuses, 401(k) Plan, Upto $600 Travel ReimbursementAbout Stability HealthcareAt Stability, we have built a nurse friendly platform that simplifies finding travel nursing jobs without the need for a recruiter.We believe in pay transparency and that is why we aggregate thousands of jobs from hospitals hourly displaying full pay rates creating a no-haggle no-hassle job search approach.Once a nurse selects an assignment of their choice, we then empower the nurses with an easy profile generator allowing nurses to submit themselves for an interview with confidence knowing they've booked an open job with the pay and location of their choice.Stability displays to their nurses the best travel nursing jobs allowing for faster submissions, scheduling of Interviews, and ultimately landing our nurses their preferred assignment.

About:Oleria is an enterprise cybersecurity startup that raised $8M in seed funding led by Salesforce Ventures with participation from Tapestry VC and industry luminary angel investors. We recognize that identity based attacks on software as a service (SaaS) applications are becoming increasingly common, highlighting the importance of addressing access risks to prevent data breaches. Traditional access management methods are human-intensive and often have significant unidentified gaps, making it challenging to manage access risks effectively. At Oleria, we are on a mission to revolutionize access control tooling for enterprise SaaS applications, aiming to reduce the opportunity and scope of data breaches drastically.Oleria was founded by notable industry senior leaders Jim Alkove and Jagadeesh Kunda, with deep security, data, and SaaS experience building and securing some of the world's largest platforms and products used by billions of people worldwide every day. Our customers are Fortune 500 corporations and public sector organizations, making your contributions vital to improving data security for millions worldwide.Job Overview:We are looking for a talented Web Developer to join our team. As an early hire, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our company's websites and web applications. You should have excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for creating high-quality, user-friendly web experiences.Many fundamental choices have not yet been made, so this greenfield background is an unusual opportunity to have broad ownership and ability to define requirements and goals for across product delivery, tools, and process.Above all, you have a bias for action. You love getting product out the door and learning from tight feedback loops, and love the satisfaction you'll receive from knowing that your contributions are directly improving the security of data for millions of people in the world.ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop, and maintain responsive websites and web applications. Collaborate with the design and marketing teams to ensure a seamless and visually appealing user experience. Implement user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Optimize web applications for maximum speed and scalability. Ensure cross-browser compatibility and responsive design. Implement security best practices to protect against common web threats. Optimize web performance and loading times for an exceptional user experience. Work closely with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and developers. QualificationsBachelors in computer science or related, or equivalent experience3+ years of professional experience in web developmentProficiency in front-end technologies such as React, Typescript, Next.js, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Experience with content management systems such as WebflowProven experience as a web developer, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work. Experience with web development tools, and version control systems (e.g., Git) Knowledge of responsive web design principles. Have shipped and operated high-scale commercial SaaS products, with all that entailsContinuous learning mindset to stay updated with the latest web development trends and technologies. Ability to work and thrive in a fast-moving world with ambiguity and potential change as daily companionsExcellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience in cybersecurity or SaaS industry, especially with Access, Identity and Governance would be a plusWhat we offer:Competitive salary, equity, and benefits package. Opportunities for professional growth and advancement in a fast-growing company. The chance to work directly with our co-founders and contribute meaningfully to shaping the company's direction. A collaborative and dynamic work environment with a dedicated team of professionals. The annual compensation range being offered for this role depending on individual candidate level and experience is $90,000 to $180,000 including base salary and equity.

Our team today includes world-class researchers and industrial designers, PhDs, creators, founders of successful startups, and zero egos. We are backed by top venture capital funds like Kleiner Perkins, Lux Capital, DCVC, Spark Capital, and others.The company is headquartered in Cambridge, MA and has an office in San Francisco, CA.Lumafield is bringing volumetric visualization, inspection and analysis tools to the web. You will have ownership over projects as you help us develop new features and get them into the hands of customers quickly. Actual salaries may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to work location, experience, and performance. All full time employees receive an equity grant.Lumafield offers both competitive cash and equity compensation, as well as a health & wellness stipend, 401k, parental leave, flexible PTO, commuter benefits, company wide events and more!Lumafield is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, because the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. The RoleWe're looking for an experienced frontend engineer. We want someone with programming (and ideally also design) chops who can own the frontend and take our product to the next level as we scale.We're building a PaaS that runs in a user's own cloud (basically Heroku on k8s) and we've converted some of Heroku's largest enterprise users as well as a large base of high-growth startups despite starting just a little over a year ago.Now that we're hitting our stride, we're focused on capturing as much mindshare as possible, so we need someone who can take the polish and devX of our PaaS to the next level.This role would involve maximum ownership. Our entire engineering team is currently full-stack (leaning backend) or on infra side. I (Justin) do most of the day-to-day FE/UX work as a founder, so we want someone with more experience who can do it worlds better.You WillObsess over delivering the best possible user flow for teams on PorterElevate the design language of our platformIncrementally refactor the frontend without hampering the team's velocityRaise the standard for code quality and our engineering cultureSome Of The Technical Challenges We FaceRock solid UI/UX for onboarding - our platform automatically provisions resources to the user's cloud account and needs to robustly handle a variety of permissions and infra-related errors.Abstracting CI and Kubernetes - any PaaS spans a variety of use cases, so building a consistent and useful layer of abstraction requires constant awareness of the needs of many user profiles.Auto-Generated Frontend - each of our app/add-on templates uses a form.yaml file that programmatically generates a settings UI on the dashboard using a library of our own input primitives. Expanding and testing the functionality of these templates is non-trivial.Tech StackWeb: React (styled-components), TypeScriptBackend: Go, Kubernetes + Helm APIs, Postgres, RedisInfrastructure: AWS, GCPPorter is open source. You can view our entire codebase here: https://github.com/porter-dev/porter.This role is strictly in-person in NYC.Interested? Email your resume to jobs at porter.run and let us know why you would be a great fit for this role.

Kollabio, a growing boutique digital startup that provides Digital Transformation solutions and services to public and private sector organizations, is looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst to support the manual and automated testing/validation of digital solutions built for various Federal agencies.As a QA Analyst, You will closely collaborate with product owners, designers and developers in an Agile setting, to support testing of web and mobile based digital applications across Federal and Commercial customers. Success requires a natural curiosity, ability to define and decompose problems, and a strong background in framing test cases using Gherkin. This is a mid-level position that provides ample opportunity to grow while coaching and mentoring other members of a growing team.We‚Äôre looking for someone who is:A problem solver. You aren't afraid to go deep, experiment, learn on the fly, and do the Passionate about turning complex business requirements into working software that delights users. Humble but opinionated. You have lots of ideas, yet you are happy to shift directions when a better path emerges. You take your work much more seriously than you take yourself. An active collaborator. You want feedback on your work early and often, and you get a kick out of a collaborative process because it challenges you to do better work. Engaging beyond 1s and 0s. You understand that empathizing with our customers, building relationships with your co-workers, and going deep on the product makes you a better teammate and a better. ResponsibilitiesCreate Test Plans, Test Cases and Test Scripts to support manual quality assurance testing of web and mobile applications. Analyze User Stories and prepare test cases in Gherkin format. Work closely with Product Owner/Business Analyst, User Experience Designer, Technical Lead and Developers to support backlog refinement. Participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies within a 2-week Sprint cycle. Execute test cases and record test results in Atlassian Jira. Analyze and verify test results and work with developers to resolve issues. Identify, document, and track software defects and inconsistencies. Proactively communicate with team members to clarify requirements and resolve any issues. Conduct both manual and automated testing as required. Continuously improve testing processes and methodologies to optimize efficiency and effectiveness. Participate in release and deployment planning, ensuring all necessary testing is completed prior to launch. Write SQL statements to extract Data and verify the output Data of the reports. Influence strategic roadmaps from a Quality Engineering standpoint and manage tactical bi-weekly release operations RequirementsRequirements3 ‚Äì 5 + years of experience as a QA Analyst, preferably in a Web application development environment and in an Agile setting. Solid understanding of software testing methodologies and quality assurance best practices. Experience writing user stories and developing test cases. Experience using Miro or other similar flow-charting tools. Full Software Development Lifecycle experience. Experience with software QA practices including, conducting functional, integration, system, and regression testing. Attention to detail and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. Experience participating in Facilitated Workshops for requirements analysis. Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written) and ability to communicate with internal and external customers and all levels of management, including communicating technical information to non-technical audiences. A strong intellectual curiosity to continually challenge what exists and explore what should be changed to best meet evolving business and market. Desired Skills & Qualifications:Experience working with Jira for storing user stories and bug tracking Experience working in a management consulting or technology consulting firm especially within digital or interactive space. Agile Methodology experience and understanding. BenefitsLocation: Local candidates (VA, MD, DC) preferred but open to considering remote for the right candidateEducation: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related fieldJob Types: Full time, W2-SalariedPay: $90,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year (DoE)Our Values and CultureWe believe everything great starts with inspired people empowered to collaborate, innovate, and deliver awesome customer experiences. People are at the heart of our operations. Our people are what make us thrive. We are a company that rewards commitment to excellence, entrepreneurialism and focus on customer success. We take our work seriously ‚Äì but also take time to unwind, have fun and connect with each other and our customers.‚ÄØWe bring people‚ÄØwith diverse backgrounds together and empower them to co-create with our customers to solve problems and build better experiences for their users.‚ÄØAt Kollabio, you‚Äôll be envisioning, designing, and building solutions that change the way businesses interact with their customers. While you dedicate your time to making the world a more engaging place, we invest in your growth, success, and happiness, and celebrate our accomplishments together.Learn about the‚ÄØvalues that guide our business, our offerings, our product development, and our brand.Our BenefitsCollaborative, transparent culture and flexible schedules Performance-based Bonus, spot bonuses and other incentive plans Health insurance coverage from day one Medical, Dental and Vision plans (with majority company contribution) Health Savings Account (HSA) plan (with company contribution) Employee options for long and short-term disability plans Ability to participate in 401(k) program Employee Professional Development and Education Assistance (Funds to go toward tuition or job-related certifications) Ability to participate in an innovation and project-based incentive bonus pool (in addition to performance-based bonus) About UsKollabio is an innovative digital startup that provides digital transformation solutions and services to the Federal Government and commercial organizations. Founded with a vision of becoming a new breed of consulting partner, we offer full-stack digital expertise, products, and solutions to help traditional organizations re-invent business models, reimagine customer experiences, optimize business operations and deliver technology initiatives faster through digital. Our solutions include Digital Strategy, Experience Design, Cloud, Agile, DevOps, and Intelligent Automation.Kollabio, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee based on race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.For more information please visit:https://www.kollabio.com/

$55,000.00.Additional Compensation: Potential yearly bonus (estimated at 3% to 8% of base salary) & equity grant.We've got you covered!90% of Medical insurance covered75% of Dental & Vision insurance covered100% of Short-term & Long-term disability coveredFor the costs we can't cover we offer HSA & FSA optionsHappy employees are the best employees100% covered Employee Assistance Program that offers counseling, financial planning, legal assistance, and much more!We work to live our extraordinary lives:13 Paid Company Holidays per year to ensure that you have time to spend with your friends and family. We host an all-staff event every quarter for our people to come together, bond and meet each others' family and friends. What We Are Looking ForMobot is seeking a tech-savvy and detail-oriented doer to help us build best-in-class operations for quality assurance. You may have built your own app or recently finished code bootcamp and want to break into software development. Maybe you've worked in tech retail, Quality Assurance, technical support. Maybe you are a gamer with an eye for detail. No matter your background, you are a team player who is comfortable delivering high quality results in an incredibly dynamic environment.This role is in-person in NYC. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.The roleQuality Assurance (QA) Analysts are on the front lines of Mobot - ensuring we find and report bugs to our customers so that they can improve their apps. As an QA Analyst at Mobot, you will execute tests, analyze results, and report observations to our customers. You will also be an important front-end voice for our team, working cross-functionally with Customer Success and Engineering, as we improve our internal products. To be successful in this role, you must be exceptionally detail-oriented, customer-centric, and a great problem solver.If you are hustling to break into tech but aren't sure how - you love technology, have an uncanny eye for detail, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we think this role might be right for you.ResponsibilitiesWe are a small but mighty team where everyone wears many hats. This is a dynamic role, and responsibilities will evolve as you grow with Mobot. Key responsibilities include (but may not be limited to):Perform and oversee manual tests for multiple mobile applicationsCollaborate with internal team members to address incoming customer requestsDocument your findings from testing via written text and video capturesAssist the Customer Success team with investigations focused on mobile app bugs discovered during testingPlan and execute automated mobile application testing with mechanical robotsAttend daily stand up meetings and document processesAbout YouDetail-oriented - you have a deep attention to detail. You probably found a typo or formatting error in this job posting. Our customers rely on us to observe nuanced issues in their mobile apps and provide detailed contextTech-savvy - you have strong knowledge and experience with computers and smartphones. We test on various iOS/Android phones & tablets. We also use MacBooks. Time management - you are able to efficiently manage multiple customer requests while delivering in a timely mannerExcellent communicator - you can clearly articulate your ideas through verbal and written mediums to teammatesLogical and critical thinker - you can quickly get up to speed and think on your feetThe boring stuff - you are proficient with modern productivity software - Google Suite, slack, etc. Bonus pointsStartup experience - there are many different types of dynamic and fast-paced environments, but we think startup experience is unique. You thrive in this environment and have experience balancing multiple, sometimes competing prioritiesQuality Assurance background - you have prior experience as a Quality Assurance Tester or similar rolePassionate about robots!Compensation & BenefitsCompetitive compensationGenerous PTO, including 1 week company-wide winter break401k with company matchStock optionsComprehensive health benefitsPaid family leaveCommuter benefitsMuch more!SalaryMobot is committed to delivering competitive and equitable pay for our employees. The expected base pay range for this position is $60,000 - $70,000/year. However, the base pay offered may vary depending on multiple factors, including the candidate's relevant skills, experience, and location. Mobot's total rewards package also includes performance bonuses, our comprehensive benefits and equity program, and PTO.How To ApplyDoes this role sound like a good fit? Interested candidates should submit a resume.We may be a robotics & automation business - but rest assured we read every application we receive (seriously!)Mobots come in all shapes, sizes, and backgrounds. We're focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you're excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we still encourage you to apply.

Our team is made up of researchers, chemists, and pharmaceutical scientists, but we‚Äôre also enthusiasts, cannasseurs, and members of the cannabis community. We support the community by providing anyone interested in or passionate about cannabis with access to analytical product testing as well as information to help guide their cultivation, consumption, or enjoyment of marijuana, hemp, and cannabis-derived products.As the first independent cannabis testing laboratory to be certified by the state of Massachusetts, we are proud to offer analytical testing and R&D services to MMJ and adult-use cannabis providers, patients, doctors, caregivers, or anyone crafting their own cannabis products. Who We Are:Calm is the leading mental health brand, on a mission to support everyone on every step of their mental health journey. With the #1 app for sleep, meditation and relaxation, Calm‚Äôs transformational mindfulness content supports users across seven languages in more than 190 countries.We are hiring remote workers for this role in the San Francisco Bay Area, Los Angeles, or NYC. At this time, only candidates in these locations will be considered.What We Do:We‚Äôre the Consumer Marketing team at Calm. We‚Äôre responsible for stewarding the brand across all touchpoints, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating talk-worthy moments that generate conversation and keep Calm top of mind in an ever-growing category. Our team oversees Social, Editorial, Product Marketing, Content Marketing and Brand, and we‚Äôre looking for experienced, skilled and passionate candidates to join our team.If you‚Äôre looking to make an impact in the world of mental wellness through social, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.What You‚Äôll Do:This role will be the social lead at Calm, and will be responsible for managing the social media strategy and execution across Calm‚Äôs social presence, working cross-functionally with our Editorial, Content, and PR teams to develop best-in-class content and maintain Calm‚Äôs standing as the leading brand in the mental health category. They‚Äôll report into the Director of Consumer Marketing. This person will have oversight across all social channels from start to finish, and will be responsible for refreshing the current strategy, leading the vision for creative concepts and briefing, and be comfortable with day-to-day executional work. It‚Äôs critical this person is passionate about social media, mental health, culture, and has a solid understanding of how social media and PR can work together to create meaningful, earned-first, social-centric moments that drive conversation.This role will lead the social strategy for major marketing initiatives, new in-app content launches and product releases, coordinating cross-functionally with the teams required to bring the strategy to life. They‚Äôll manage the workflow for the social team to ensure all work is on-brand, executed flawlessly and at speed when necessary, while pushing the boundaries of innovation and taking creative risks to keep the brand top of mind in an ever-crowded social ecosystem.This person will need to be a strong individual contributor, and feel comfortable working with a team of contractors (in addition to internal team members) to bring their strategy to life.Independently lead the development of Calm‚Äôs social strategy across all platforms, including, but not limited to, Instagram and Reels, TikTok, X, Threads, YouTube and Facebook. Develop earned-first, social-centric ideas in partnership with the PR team to drive social buzz/conversation and earned media around the most meaningful brand and cultural moments. Collaborate with Calm‚Äôs internal and external creative teams and a nimble team of social freelancers to execute against a refreshed social strategy.Own the social strategy for major marketing priorities, brand moments, new in-app content and talent releases, product and feature releases and more.Oversee partnerships with key platforms including Meta, TikTok, YouTube and others to ensure Calm has access to new innovation opportunities within the platforms to drive engagement and grow our audiences.Collaborate closely with XFN teams, including Creative, Content, PR, Paid Marketing, Partnerships & Product to bring the social strategy to life and spot opportunities for growth-drivers across the org.Monitor and analyze content performance in partnership with Calm‚Äôs analytics lead to apply key learnings to both improve performance in real time and optimize future strategies.Who You Are:7+ years proven experience creating, executing, and leading social marketing in a rapid growth environmentPassion for culture and bringing earned-centric, social-first ideas to life for brands Strong understanding and eye for social content and brand creativeDeep knowledge and expertise of social platformsAbility to deliver insights and points of view based on dataAbility to oscillate between high-level strategy and day-to-day execution with a small, nimble team ‚Äì you‚Äôre not afraid to get your hands dirty Ability to collaborate and influence internallyAbility to ideate and execute at a fast pace in order to seize reactive and/or trend-centric moments impactfullyExcellent verbal, written and visual communications skillsExcellent attention to detailNice to Haves:Bachelors/advanced degree, or equivalent experience Previous experience in tech, wellness or a similar fast-paced industry Work experience or personal interest in the mental health space Experience thriving in a remote-first company Minimum Requirements:This role requires 10 years of related experience. The anticipated salary range for this position is $139,500 - $195,300. The base salary range represents the low and high end of Calm‚Äôs salary range for this position. Not all candidates will be eligible for the upper end of the salary range. Why work for Kreg Therapeutics?üöÄ No Limits: Escape corporate constraints, we won't hold you back; we want to grow and want you to grow with usüé© Magic Role: Wear many hats, try new things, experiment, learn; we want to help you implement YOUR ideasüè• Impactful Care: Work closely with patients and clinicians in the ICU.ü§ù Leader Collaboration: Work closely with me and other senior executives, we love to hear from youOur mission is to help hospitals improve the management and outcomes of their most complex patients.  Kreg‚Äôs Beds provide an innovative modality to get complex patients out of bed, mobilized and stabilized so they can progress to PT, LTACH, and ultimately home. Because not all the patients are the same, not all the beds should be the same. Kreg‚Äôs offers a unique portfolio of specialty beds and 24/7 rental services to allow clinicians to safely and efficiently mobilize those complex patients. We are a small company, on a mission to stand out from the crowd and make Kreg Beds the #1 hospital partner to deliver better outcomes for complex patients.The Supply Chain Manager is a pivotal leadership role responsible for overseeing and optimizing all aspects of the supply chain process, including Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP). This role involves strategic planning, procurement, inventory management, production coordination, logistics, risk assessment, process improvement, and team leadership, with a particular focus on aligning sales projections with operational capabilities.The Supply Chain Manager will play a critical role in ensuring seamless operations, cost effectiveness, and timely delivery of products to customers while maintaining a synchronized approach between sales and operational teams.Key Responsibilities:Owns the Sales & Operations Planning process and delegates ownership of the applicable components across the organization, ensuring the S&OP process is executed within the design cadence and has the requisite inputs and outputs at each phase. Accountable to lead/ facilitate the Executive S&OP Review and the Integrated Operational Review component of S&OP and provide assurance of the effective leadership and facilitation of the Product Review, Demand Review, and Supply Review within the S&OP process.Educates own team and others in the organization on supply chain best practices. Builds capability across the organization in S&OP competency within each of the functional areas.Accountable for developing and maintaining the S&OP/Operating plan.Identifies opportunities and works with IT to enable IT system, process, and reporting capabilities to support the effective execution of each step in the S&OP process.Assures the change management agenda and outputs from the S&OP cycle are effectively executed to enable the agreed organizational capacity and capability as endorsed from the Executive S&OP Review. Coordinates production schedules and ensures production processes are aligned with demand forecast.Work closely with production teams to streamline processes and enhance efficiency.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to forecast demand, plan inventory levels, and ensure timely availability of materials.Optimize inventory levels by balancing costs and operational requirements in alignment with sales projections.Coordinate production schedules, enhancing production efficiency while considering sales forecasts.Analyze data to inform decisions and report on key performance indicators related to S&OP metrics.Ensure to achieve the targeted timeline with optimal working hours and production planning.Responsible for production efficiency and productivity.Essential Functions: 10+ years of progressive supply chain planning experience in both supply and demand planning with progressively broader team leadership responsibility.Experience navigating ERP systems and utilizing their functionality (and/or ‚Äúbolt on‚Äù tools as required) to support S&OP process capability.  Demonstrated management and experience in a complex supply chain environments and experience with diverse supply chain processes & systems in a variety of different manufacturing business environments.  Collaborate with sales, marketing, and operations teams to align demand forecasts with production and inventory capabilities. Lead the procurement process by identifying suppliers, negotiating contracts, and ensuring timely delivery of quality materials. Implement supplier performance evaluation systems to maintain high standards and meet S&OP targets. Manage inventory levels to support S&OP targets, minimizing excess stock and stockouts. Implement inventory tracking systems to monitor inventory turns and align them with sales projections. Collect, analyze, and interpret supply chain data to inform decisions and support S&OP initiatives. Prepare regular reports on S&OP performance and key supply chain metrics for management. Ensure supply chain operations adhere to industry regulations, ethical standards, and company policies, considering S&OP implications. Required Experience & Job Requirements:10+ years of progressive supply chain planning experience in both supply and demand planning with progressively broader team leadership responsibility. APICS, CSCP or CPIM certification preferred.Medical IndustriesManufacturingMRP / ERP SystemsMaterial ManagementInventory ManagementInternational & Domestic SourcingVendor Qualification Supplier AuditingDomestic & International LogisticsLean ManufacturingKanban Purchasing Benefits Include:Comprehensive Benefit package(Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K & Life Insurance)Paid travel expensesVacation, Personal & Sick time

LaSalle Network is partnering with one of the country's best known service brands to hire a Regional Supply Chain Manager. Reporting to the Director Warehouse Operations, the Regional Supply Chain Manager will be responsible for operational and P&L management for warehouses and distribution centers in their region. This role will focus on ensuring supply chain is functioning efficiently and hitting KPIs. The Regional Supply Chain Manager will drive strategy that accounts for sourcing unavailable parts, inventory control, logistics and distribution.  Regional Supply Chain Manager Responsibilities:Lead a team of Warehouse Managers and a Sourcing/Procurement Manager, encouraging collaboration and continuous improvement in their own respective locations and regionally; provide succession planning and development/coaching opportunitiesCommunicate business plans to the Warehouse Managers and Sourcing Manager; connect plans to regional goals, local retail stores and the organization's broader missionIdentify the capabilities needed to meet the current and emerging business needs of the region; drive consistency in the warehouses by executing on the organization's best practicesCreate regional supply chain plan in conjunction with leadership in order to achieve specific goals and KPIs for region working within the established supply chain management plan; ensure that supply chains are deeply integrated between the warehouse and retail to release efficiencies, drive cost savings and increase performanceProvide Fleet management and operations; identify and resolve problems with the fleet vehicles ensuring the capacity to deliverResponsible for P&L management for the regional supply chain; partner with Finance and leadership on budgets (key cost areas include large purchase costs, vehicle fleet costs and staffing costs)Partner with Warehouse Managers to ensure that inventory remains cost effective while meeting customer demandsEnsure Warehouse Managers are leading their associates to conduct cycle counts and replenishment system updates, as well as following proper procedures to address or align breakage, shrink, cycle counts and RTVs (return to vendor) and POD  Regional Supply Chain Manager Requirements:Bachelors degree in a related field7+ years of experience in operations, supply chain, logistics and/or sales environmentString knowledge of marketing and operations techniquesValid state issued drivers license requiredAbility to indirectly lead, coach and achieve results through others and to develop associates so that they meet their individual/career goals in tandem with the organization's KPIsAbility to travel a minimum of 50% If you are interested in this role, please apply!  Thank you,  Becky Clifton Senior Project Manager LaSalle Network LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v. What we‚Äôre buildingOur vision is to electrify all waterborne vessels, and we're starting with electric water sport boats.Gas boats dominate today‚Äôs marine industry not because of great product offerings but because of a lack of better alternatives. Boaters have grown accustomed to vehicles that feel stuck in the 1980s: unreliable, expensive, loud, noxious, and a nightmare to own and operate. They‚Äôre also awful for the water and air they reside in.By contrast, electric boats are superior in nearly every way: not only are they far more reliable and less costly to operate, but they‚Äôre also quieter, quicker, and cleaner, with no fumes or pollutants. However, they‚Äôve been held back by both the technology and the talent to make them truly competitive with gas alternatives. That‚Äôs Arc‚Äôs opportunity.Using modern, aerospace- and automotive-inspired techniques, we‚Äôre building our hulls, batteries, cooling systems, firmware, and software together to deliver the next generation of watercraft.What we‚Äôre looking forWe‚Äôre looking for someone that is excited by our vision, eager for the challenge, and willing to learn on the job. We pride ourselves on transparency and operate in a lean, high-trust environment that encourages everyone to take ownership over their domain.You will be a full-time member of our Supply Chain team and will work from our manufacturing facility in Los Angeles. Given that we‚Äôre a startup, you will be working in a fast-moving, dynamic environment that requires adaptability. Job DescriptionYou can be more than just ‚Äúgood‚Äù at your job, be the BEST in your career by joining the Symbia Logistics team!Symbia Logistics is a best-in-class supply chain partner, known for being a place of growth to both our clients and team members. With a focus on omni and multi-channel distribution and fulfillment services, Symbia works in some of today‚Äôs most popular industries like apparel, consumer goods, cosmetics, food and beverage, sporting goods, and pet supplies. Symbia‚Äôs mission is to deliver exceptional service and experience, to both our clients and hard-working teams. Our goal is to create a ‚ÄúSupply Change‚Äù movement by implementing new 3PL solutions that are practical and efficient for our team members to be successful. Join forces with Symbia Logistics and start building a powerful career in logistics with an organization at the forefront of growth and supply change!In the role of Supply Chain Manager, we need someone who is not afraid to be the face and voice of Symbia for our Clients. The ideal person is going to understand 3PL Operations, have a strong understanding of Logistics, be a great communicator, and have outstanding organizational skills. We take our clients needs seriously, and as the main line of communication between our Clients and our amazing Operations team we know you will too. The best part is while you are helping our clients grow, Symbia will be a place you can foster your professional and personal development! This opportunity provides you with tremendous growth potential! At Symbia, we want to be the last stop on your career journey, not just the next stop!Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesBe an ambassador! You will be a strong voice for our clients and our Operations Team. Participate and Motivate! You will be involved in client meetings and internal team meetings to obtain and communicate feedback, process appropriate action plans, and encourage our team to outperform our clients‚Äô expectations. Relationship Expert! You will build and maintain strong Client relationships with assigned accounts, including full account management, billing, understanding contractual needs, etc. Work with Operations and IT to onboard new clients and implement software changes and contractual terms. Quote special projects, ensuring profitability based on time studies and data analytics. Strong and competent problem solvers, as we want all challenges to be met in a proactive manner. Ability to perform root cause analysis to find cause of issues and immediately work to rectify any situation. Proficient in setting, tracking, and monitoring metrics and KPIs. Present data, proposals, business reviews and more with the Clients, including creating specialty reports and creating Quarterly Business Reviews both internally and externally. The right person will have a strong start-up mentality and be willing to roll their sleeves up and do the work of being on the floor and working on the floor to make sure the Clients needs are always met. Perform other duties as assigned. Education/ExperienceBachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field or an equivalent combination of training and progressively responsible experience. 3PL (Third-party Logistics) is a must in this role. Two to five years in an Account Management role working directly with 3PL clients. One to Three years as an Operations Manager, Supervisor, or Lead role needed. Advanced skill in the use of all Microsoft Office software. Strong communication and organizational skills. Confident in presentations utilizing software in front of numerous people. This candidate will spend a great deal of time on the Warehouse floor, so agility and ability to stand and walk for long periods of time is necessary. Physical Requirements & Work EnvironmentAbility to stand and sit for periods of time and to move intermittently throughout the workday. Ability to focus and have attention to detail. Strong sensory skills including eyesight, hearing, and dexterity. Ability to push, lift, carry, pull and/or throw up to 50 lbs. Adaptable to both hot and cold environments, noise, and dust exposure, and moving equipment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions. Director of Indirect Procurement Responsibilities:  Act as the procurement and contract management expert for assigned product categories, specifically within IT, financial and facilities support services  Create statements of work that outline the technical requirements for vendors  Manage the negotiation of vendor terms and conditions and associated maintenance and support for agreements  Coordinate and lead planning continuous improvements initiatives as well as project management  Meet regularly with the business to ensure needs are met in a timely and accurate fashion  Director of Indirect Procurement Requirements:  5+ years of indirect procurement experience  1+ years of experience managing people  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, purchasing, supply chain management or related field  Strong negotiation and contract management skills Thank you for your time and interest in this Director of Indirect Procurement  opportunity. We look forward to reviewing your resume!Thank you,Abby DeanProject Manager, Supply ChainLaSalle NetworkLaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.

SummaryThe Social Media Manager is responsible for the daily posting, monitoring, and engaging with our community on all @ELEMIS branded platforms. They are responsible for providing content aggregation, ideation, and management of the content calendar for social media on a consistent basis. They are responsible with sourcing, vetting, briefing, and managing relationships of content creators on an on-going basis. This role will also own social media reporting, developing data-driven reports for team and leadership analysis. They will be an expert in social media content, often creating content for owned channels as well. This is a unique role that sits at the intersection of Marketing, Education, and Customer Care. The Social Media Manager will foster one-to-one relationships across ELEMIS social media handles and have experience in customer retention and relationship development, with an understanding of skincare and beauty and a proven track record for crafting and executing content across a number of social media channels.This person will be tasked with bringing the ELEMIS brand to life and creatively showcasing what makes ELEMIS special, with a particular emphasis on growing community size and engagements. They will serve as the knowledgeable beauty confidant to nurture and grow our community of advocates for our brand fans and influencers alike.Essential ResponsibilitiesRole Responsibilities:Complete ownership of the content calendar, including crafting and implementing effective social media marketing techniques to reach and engage current customers and potential customers.Execute social media publishing and content ideas on all social media platforms, including Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, Threads and Pinterest, as well as assisting with content ideation and creation. Explore and engage with emerging social channels as appropriate.Implement a best-in-class content management strategy, engaging with internal and external content creators across platforms and ensuring high-quality deliverables that align with the aesthetic and style of the brand. Brief and manage both internal (creative, paid, internal content) and external partners (contracted content creators, brand partners) to develop high-quality content across platforms.Partner with Social Media Community Coordinator to ensure questions, comments and related opportunities are handled in a timely manner. Partner with customer service to address any consumer product and order issues.Engage daily with the ELEMIS community on UGC.Regularly share consumer social comments and insights internally and work collaboratively with NPD, marketing, and creative to inform future efforts.Spearhead weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual social media reporting, analyzing insights and next steps for social optimization.Identify brand partners and then deliver on the execution of the social and content areas of a brand partnership.Partner closely with PR/influencer team, identifying opportunities and helping to develop briefs and source creators.Research and keep up to date on social media trends, tactics, and social initiatives of our competitors.Support the identification of influential brand ambassadors to promote the ELEMIS brand on a global scale.Manage relationships with third-party vendors (Dash Hudson, Emplifi, etc)Assist in the development of social strategies to support new launches and execute brand visions for consistent messaging worldwide.Manage social media intern.Other tasks assigned.Sustainability ResponsibilityEnsure all duties carried out and actions completed in every aspect of your role, contribute to the short and long-term Sustainability Goals set-forth by the ELEMIS - Climate, Biodiversity & People Pillars.Qualifications & Characteristics3+ years in a social media related position at a related company.Strategic and creative mindset, understanding the desired ROI and being able to maximize resources to drive the highest impact.Previous experience working in Beauty/Fashion or related field within Social Media.Strong written and verbal communication skills, and attention to detail.Deep understanding of, and proficiency in, all social media platforms (e.g. Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, LinkedIn, Threads, YouTube).Knowledge of content and social media analytics, tracking and publishing/analytic tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Dash Hudson, Emplifi, etc).Experience building and executing social media marketing campaigns and calendars.Strong project management skills including managing deadlines, objectives, delivering analysis and recommendations.Excellent organization and time management skills and ability to work in fast-paced environment.Creative thinker who can brainstorm innovative ideas with a passion for learning and understanding of what makes people follow and engage on social media.Must have knowledge of viral social media trends, pop culture and the beauty space.A data-driven approach to everything you do and an ability to multi-task with competing priorities.An inventive problem solver, with a high level of accountability.A natural ability to collaborate well with others across the organization and thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.Has an ‚Äúeye‚Äù for design, lighting, quality, and aesthetics.Graphic design and video/photo editing experience a plus.The salary range for this position: $75,000-$85,000.Elemis is an equal opportunities employer. This means that, when making decisions about our employees‚Äô careers with us, our main considerations are their ability to do their jobs and develop in their roles. One way we cultivate change is by creating a more diverse and inclusive workplace and organizational culture. As part of this, we are committed to building an environment that is free from discrimination and harassment, where everyone feels respected and valued. We recruit positive minded people who share our core values and our commitment to sustainability.All Applicants:United States Applicants Only:Powered by JazzHRBciviwmeKx

Westbrook Media is seeking a talented Social Media Manager for a 3-6 month-long project. In this role, you will take the reins in curating content and overseeing key social platforms for Westbrook talent. You will be pivotal in curating captivating content and managing key social platforms for Westbrook talent. Leveraging your expertise, innovative instincts, and extensive network of creators, you will collaborate closely with internal teams to craft compelling social posts, utilizing cutting-edge tools to ensure maximum engagement and impact.Additionally, you will be the mastermind behind a meticulously organized posting calendar, ensuring timely and impactful content delivery. Your expertise will play a key role in developing innovative strategies, enabling us to effectively reach and captivate our target demographics.Your mission? To drive growth, secure earned media, and achieve key performance indicators (KPIs) that elevate our talent's presence in the digital landscape. If you're passionate about social media, brimming with innovative ideas, and ready to make a significant impact, we invite you to apply!This position will report to the SVP of Talent Digital Strategy & Innovation.In this role, you will:Manage and publish content on talent social media channels, including daily community management. Develop and pitch ideas for posts based on a growth-focused social media strategy. Monitor online cultural trends, formats, growth strategies, and user behaviors to integrate ideas into new creative. Curate videos, photos, and trends from all corners of the internet, including art, music, dance, comedy, film, and influencer culture. Manage editorial calendar to ensure key dates and holidays are observed. Copywriting and community managementSpend time on set, on location, and in the field with talent to ideate and create social media content using a mobile phone. Conduct outreach and brainstorm with creators, influencers, and publishers for collaboration opportunities. Help define social platform KPIs and prepare weekly and monthly analytics reports to better inform future creative decisions. Provide constructive feedback to the creative team to aid in the continued improvement and optimization of content. Qualifications:At least 3 years of experience managing a high visibility social account for a brand or talent. Deep understanding of major social media platforms including (but not limited to) Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Threads. Knowledge & familiarity with reporting platforms such as Sprout, Brandwatch, CrowdTangle, Netbase, etc. Strong storytelling abilities and creative skills for social media. Must be able to provide samples of previous work. Must be proficient with content creation apps such as CapCut, InShot, Photoshop, Canva, Adobe Creative CloudQualities that will yield success:Passionate about internet culture, TikTok trends, new music, and pop culture news. A quick learner, able to take the reins on a project with limited guidance. A strategic thinker, constantly thinking about how to supercharge platforms, tools, and people to reach a set of goals. An ability to present and articulate a strategy that considers the essential elements for execution, including measures of success. Highly organized and able to manage multiple workflows at once. Knowledge and interest in digital culture, especially creators/influencers and their growing foothold within pop culture. An idea factory, always coming up with new ways to keep content fresh. Westbrook is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Westbrook believes that diversity and inclusion among our colleagues are critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. At Westbrook, we carefully consider a wide range of factors to determine fair and equitable compensation. Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure guidelines, the weekly pay for this role is between $2,500 - $2,750. The final offer amount will consider a wide range of factors in making compensation decisions, including, but not limited to, a candidate's experience relevant to the job and the company's compensation philosophy.

And while we're invested in our products, we're equally invested in one another's personal development. We're tightly knit, we're genuine and we're always pushing the envelope to do a better job than we did the day before.THE OPPORTUNITY:We‚Äôre growing quickly and hiring for a Social Media Manager to own the day-to-day growth strategy, management and execution of our social media channels and communities. The right candidate is someone who is healthily obsessed about getting our story out to the world, being in front of the camera /pseudo face of the brand, while simultaneously building an engaged, authentic community around the brand. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced and results driven environment; is hard working; a natural leader; works with a strong sense of urgency; and is enthusiastic about helping us achieve our mission, as well as our business goals.WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING:Strategize ongoing content themes that align with our marketing and product launch calendars, including the look and feel, to foster and grow Alleyoop‚Äôs social presence. You‚Äôll work closely with our marketing team to ensure the overall brand story aligns at all times.Maintain the social media calendar, updating frequently based on campaign needs, brand goals and KPIs, and timely opportunities for audience engagement. This includes engaging our content creators, or other team members, as needed to gather the assets needed to execute successfully. Outline, write, and execute daily Instagram Stories based on content pillars. Delegate and project manage social creative requests to the creative team and external content creators for timely delivery.Work with the CX team to field customer service issues and questions on feed and DMs. Reach out to like-minded, non-competitive brands for giveaways and other acquisition/sales-related opportunities.Identify high-performing social content and creators to help strengthen influencer, CRM and E-comm initiatives.Proactively, and consistently, come to the table with new ideas for engagement and community building. What aren‚Äôt we doing that you‚Äôre seeing and loving? What opportunities do we have that we aren‚Äôt taking advantage of? This requires an ongoing monitoring of trends and opportunities on all social platforms. Present social data and learnings on a weekly basis to the team.WHO YOU ARE:3+ years of social media marketing experience required (preferably with a D2C beauty or skincare brand).Must live in the greater Los Angeles area and come in for photoshoots, content shoots, events + as needed Demonstrated ability and track record of building and maintaining a robust cross-channel strategy.Experience managing a team of direct reports, creative freelancers, and/or content creators.Must have experience directly communicating campaign objectives with internal influencer team or directly with influencers. Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Advertising or related field preferred.Must have knowledge of social media analytics and tool sets.An innate eye for what works and what doesn‚Äôt work on social media, and holds a pulse on pop culture and technology.Social video content creation/editing experience for TikTok, IG Reels and other emerging platforms. Photoshop and/or Indesign for basic asset creation is a huge plus. Photography experience is also a huge plus. Location: New York CityWho We Are: Banza reimagines your favorite comfort foods, like pasta, pizza, mac & cheese and rice, using chickpeas. Why? Because we know chickpeas aren't just delicious, they're also one of the most nutritious and sustainable foods. Yet 80% of the country isn't eating enough of them. Our mission is to inspire people to eat more chickpeas and other beans, making a positive impact on human health and the environment. Banza is the fastest-growing pasta brand in the country, and our products are available in over 21,000 stores nationwide. We've been named one of TIME Magazine's Best Inventions of the Year, Adweek's Best Food Brand, and are proud to have fans at Good Morning America, The New York Times, Food & Wine, Bon Appetit, and more.Your Mission: As Banza's Senior Brand Marketing Associate*, you'll assist with bringing the strategy & visual identity of the brand to life across channels like packaging and paid media, while ensuring customers and fans have a delightful experience with Banza.What you'll do:Play a critical role in our creative packaging strategy to ensure our packaging jumps off the shelves amongst the competitive set for all product lines. Suggest optimizations based on shelf opportunities & competitive audits Oversee the end-to-end packaging process for all necessary updates across several product linesBring paid media testing plan to life by developing messaging and creative assets and collaborating with an agency to identify appropriate audiencesArt direct photoshoots, contract photographers, food stylists, prop stylists, etc. and lead production and execution both on set and in post productionDesign marketing assets including emails, display banners, website & e-comm assets, and sales materialsWork with our food service team on marketing support for new opportunities Who you are:You have about 5 years of experience in roles involving creative marketing, packaging, and project management*You have design experience and are deeply familiar with Photoshop and Adobe IllustratorYou have experience managing timelines and are able to organize information into plans You've led photoshoots and are comfortable briefing and leading external designers, photographers, and other creative partners to get the outcome you needYou have a passion for food and the sub-culture around it You have a roll-up your sleeves attitude and are excited about jumping into new projectsYou would describe yourself as equal parts creative visionary and organizational mastermindYou write, speak, and engage with clarity and humor You can go into our midtown office once a weekWe are open to hiring someone at a manager level for this role if they have significant previous experience with strategic packaging design and/or art directionWe're aware of the research showing that historically underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for a job if they don't believe that they meet all of the criteria. Do you hesitate to submit an application because you believe you need to check every box? Please apply anyway with a thoughtful cover letter! We would love to hear from you to discuss how you can help us build a great team at Banza.Our Commitment: Banza is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. To achieve our mission of inspiring people to eat more chickpeas and other beans, we greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which comes from diversity of all types, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do and the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with all abilities, people of color, and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.Banza is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics. Banza will consider qualified applicants including those with criminal histories consistent with legal requirements.Compensation, Perks, And BenefitsOur salary ranges are based on verified market data and our philosophy of paying competitively for our size and industry. In addition to base salary, full-time team members receive equity in the company, medical, dental, and vision insurance through United Healthcare, free Banza products, and monthly stipends for fitness, internet, and cell phones.Individual pay rate decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, skillset, and balancing internal equity relative to peers at the company. We expect the majority of the candidates who are offered roles at our company to fall healthily throughout the range based on these factors. The salary range for this role is $90,000 - $105,000. The range is for the expectations as laid out in the job description, however, we are often open to a wide variety of profiles, and recognize that the person we hire may be less experienced (or more senior) than this job description as posted. If that ends up being the case, the updated salary range will be communicated to you as a candidate.To Apply: Write a cover letter describing why you want to join Banza and would be an excellent fit for this role, and then apply directly to this posting. If you have any questions, please email jobs@eatbanza.com.

ABOUT THE CLIENT:The Black Futures Lab (501c3) works to make Black communities powerful in politics. BFL transforms Black communities into constituencies that wield independent political power at the municipal, state, and federal levels. The problems our communities face are complex; the solutions to those problems require imagination, experimentation, and political power. We advance strategies that help us imagine the alternatives we deserve while building political power at the local, state, and national levels to implement those alternatives. To learn more about the Black Futures Lab, please visit www.blackfutureslab.org.  The Black Futures Lab is hiring for a Social Media Strategist position. This is a shared position with the Black Futures Lab‚Äôs sister organization Black to the Future Action Fund. DESCRIPTION OF THE POSITIONThe Social Media Strategist will design and implement social media strategies that support the organization's broader goals, strategies, and campaigns. They will develop content consistent with the organization‚Äôs tone of voice and brand guidelines and will work to grow our social media presence. The Social Media Strategist will also be responsible for cultivating new ways to deepen engagement and supporters' sense of identity and involvement with specific campaigns and the organization as a whole. The Social Media Strategist will report directly to the Marketing and Public Relations Manager.The ideal candidate will have an in-depth understanding of social media platforms, a proven track record of designing successful social media campaigns and developing and curating high-quality content on social platforms, and the ability to track and analyze key metrics in order to optimize content and engagement strategies. The ideal candidate will also have at least three years of experience developing content for political or electoral campaigns. Job Description:
Job ID-716504Title-Junior Info Security Analyst-Contract to HireLocation-Hybrid work in Indianapolis, IN 46204Duration-Contract to HireNumber of positions-3Pay Rate till Contract-$30.00/hr on W-2This position is a contract to hire after 12 months with a starting salary of $66,000 and comprehensive benefit package.This is a hybrid work schedule. Please confirm the resource understands this requirement.US Citizen/GC AcceptableInterview Type-In person onlySelected resource will be the point of contact for one or more agencies. For agencies already participating in the service, the individual will assist the agency in continuing to remediate any issues found in the initial report and begin working towards the next phase of the program.
